Title: Data Scientist (Honey Team)
Description:
Hi there!

We are Semrush, a global IT company developing our own product – a platform for digital marketers. New stars are born here, so don’t miss your chance.

This is our role Data Scientist for those who want to turn ideas into reality using code, algorithms, and maybe a bit of magic

Tasks in the role


Prompt Engineering: Develop and refine prompts to optimize NLP model performance
Text Generation: Design, implement, and optimize models for producing coherent, contextually appropriate text outputs while maintaining high standards of text quality
Text Classification: Develop and improve models to accurately categorize and label text data, such as determining formality levels and classifying topics
Model Evaluation: Continuously evaluate and improve models using standard NLP metrics and develop custom metrics to ensure high performance, accuracy, and text quality



Who we are looking for


3+ years of experience.
Proficiency in writing clean, maintainable Python code.
Experience with natural language processing (NLP).
Experience with open-source LLMs like LLaMa and Phi-3, and API-based LLMs such as GPT, Claude AI, Gemini.
Strong understanding of the principles of machine learning algorithms, probability theory, statistics, linear algebra.
Experience working with databases.



They say there are no perfect candidates, but that might well be you, if


Proficiency with visualization tools
Experience using Docker
Ability to write tests for code
Experience conducting code reviews
You share our common values: Trust, because we prefer to speak up and be our true selves; Sense of Ownership, because it’s not worth wasting time on something you don’t believe in; and enthusiasm for Constant Changes, because we are always looking to make things better



A Bit About The Team

You can get to know the team better at one of the interviews, but some brief information about future colleagues will be useful now.

Honey team is responsible for the data science aspects of content tools such as Content Marketing Toolkit, ContentShake, and GoodContent Hub. Focusing on NLP and ML components, we work closely with other development teams to enhance product capabilities and deliver innovative solutions.

We will try to create all the right conditions for you to work and rest comfortably


It’s up to you to decide what work format works best for you. You can #wfo, #wfh, or mix both.
Flexible working day start
Unlimited PTO
Hobby benefit
Breakfast, snacks, and coffee at the office
Corporate events
Training, courses, conferences
Gifts for employees



Finally, a Little More About Our Company

We’ve been developing our product for 15 years and have been awarded G2's Top 100 Software Products, Global and US Search Awards 2021, Great Place to Work Certification, Deloitte Technology Fast 500 and many more. In March 2021 Semrush went public and started trading on the NYSE with the SEMR ticker.

10,000,000+ users in America, Europe, Asia, and Australia have already tried Semrush, and over 1,000 people around the world are working on its development. The Semrush team is constantly growing.

Semrush is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, creed, color, national origin, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, ancestry, physical or mental disability, or medical condition including medical characteristics, genetic identity, marital status, military service, or any other classification protected by applicable local, state or federal laws. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements, merit, and individual qualifications.

Olga

Researcher

olga.pichugina@semrush.com
Show more

Title: Data Scientist | ML Engineer
Description:
Capitole Consulting es una de las mejores consultoras IT y el lugar en el que quieres estar. ¿Por qué?




🤝 Nuestros empleados lo primero. Creemos en un modelo diferente, más humano, colocamos a las personas en el centro de nuestra empresa.

👨‍💻 Proyectos interesantes. Tecnologías de vanguardia. Metodologías ágiles

🚀 Felicidad y baja tasa de rotación

👛 1200€ anuales de formación a la carta

🕓 Horario flexible

🌏 Más de 900 profesionales preparados, con hasta 27 nacionalidades

🎯 Trayectoria profesional a medida

📆 Seguimiento mensual. Evaluación 360º con revisión del salario

🩺 Seguro médico privado

💰 Retribución flexible

🦾 Plan Andjoy (Gymforless)

👥 Comunidades tecnológicas

🥳 Un montón de eventos increíbles, somos una gran familia




Buscamos perfiles desde junior a senior como Data Scientist con conocimientos en Machine Learning para incorporarse al equipo de un importante cliente francés del sector automóvil. Podrás disfrutar de trabajo 100% remoto con jornada intensiva los viernes y horarios flexibles para que concilies tu vida personal y laboral.




¿Qué buscamos?




Experiencia como Data Scientist con conocimientos en modelos de Machine Learning tradicional.
Conocimiento en Google Cloud.
Valorable conocimiento en Vertex AI.
Valorable conocimiento en Generative AI.
Amplia experiencia con Python (Pandas, DASK, SKLearn, Matplot, Seaborn, TensorFlow, Keras).
Espíritu de equipo es imprescindible.
Mente abierta, proactividad y capacidad para proponer mejoras.
Inglés B2 mínimo, valorable francés.




Envíanos tu perfil aunque sientas que esta oportunidad no es para ti. Tenemos más proyectos relacionados con este campo que queremos comentarte.




Who we are 👇

https://capitole-consulting.com/

https://capitole-consulting.com/game/




Feel free to send us your profile, we look forward to meeting you! 💙

Title: ML Engineer
Description:
We are One Team. We make it happen. We are Unstoppable.




BABEL es una consultora tecnológica multinacional especializada en aplicar sus servicios y conocimiento tecnológico en los procesos de aceleración digital de sus clientes, grandes empresas y organismos públicos.




Estamos buscando profesionales como tú que nos ayuden a llegar Marte 2025.




¿Qué es Marte 2025?




¡Es nuestro objetivo! Llegar a 5000 babelievers en el mundo, es el reto que tenemos por delante, y por ello necesitamos profesionales que nos aporten innovación, liderazgo y experiencia internacional.







¿Qué buscamos?




Responsabilidades:

Colaboración en el desarrollo de modelos avanzados de Deep Learning, utilizando tanto datos estructurados como no estructurados, enfocados principalmente a NLP y LLMs.
Puesta en producción de los modelos desarrollados.
Diseño y desarrollo de pipelines de entrenamiento y validación.
Implementación de técnicas de MLOPs para la monitorización de los modelos desplegados

Requisitos:

+3 años de experiencia desarrollando en Python
Experiencia en desarrollo de pipelines de ML
Experiencia en herramientas de contenerización: Docker / Kubernettes
Experiencia en el manejo de APIs
Castellano e inglés fluido.




Desebale:

Se valorará también conocimiento de Databricks y manejo de Azure







¿Qué ofrecemos?




Babel es una compañía en un momento precioso de expansión, tenemos muchas oportunidades de desarrollo y un gran entorno de trabajo, basado en la colaboración y la solidaridad.




Trabajar en Babel es unirse a un equipo de personas con una misión compartida y a un modelo de compañía centrado en valores.




Además,

Apostamos por la flexibilidad laboral-personal. (Sistema de vacaciones por puntos, teletrabajo y flexibilidad).
Invertimos en la formación de nuestros Babelievers.
Invertimos en tu salud física y emocional. (Seguro Médico Privado/ Seguro de vida, entrenador personal y programa de wellbeing).
Invertimos también en tu tiempo libre (Actividades en la naturaleza, campeonatos deportivos, suscripción a plataforma streaming (por Ej. Netflix)
Participamos del crecimiento de la compañía y reconocemos la participación de cada persona (Bono de Beneficios).
Ponemos foco en trabajar con últimas tecnologías y proyectos innovadores, pero sobre todo, acompañamos a la transformación digital y acercamos la tecnología a la sociedad.




¿Aceptas el desafío? ¡Te esperamos!







En cumplimiento de la normativa vigente en materia de protección de datos te informamos que el responsable de tus datos personales es GRUPO BABEL (consultar empresas en la política de privacidad), y los utilizará para gestionar tus procesos de selección, tanto actuales como futuros y el resto de finalidades descritas en la web. Este tratamiento está basado en el consentimiento del candidato. Los datos personales recabados no serán en ningún caso cedidos a terceros salvo por obligaciones legales expresas. Puedes ejercer los derechos que te asisten sobre protección de datos en la dirección data.protection@babelgroup.com. Toda la información sobre política de privacidad en nuestra web.

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer: Personalization (Remote)
Description:
Constructor is the only search and product discovery platform tailor-made for enterprise ecommerce where conversions matter. Constructor's AI-first solutions make it easier for shoppers to discover products they want to buy and for ecommerce teams to deliver highly personalized experiences that drive impressive results. Optimizing specifically for ecommerce metrics like revenue, conversion rate and profit, Constructor generates consistent $10M+ lifts for some of the biggest brands in ecommerce, such as Sephora, Petco, home24, Maxeda Brands, Birkenstock and The Very Group. Constructor is a U.S. based company that was founded in 2015 by Eli Finkelshteyn and Dan McCormick. For more, visit: constructor.io.

About The Team

The Personalization team, within the Machine Learning Chapter, plays a central role in implementing algorithms that optimize for business KPIs like revenue & conversions and increase user engagement via personalizing results for a given user. We focus on metrics over features, arming our ranking algorithms with powerful personalization that brings value to customers in the way they care the most about.

The team is a cross-functional team, consisting of Machine Learning, Backend, and Frontend engineers as well as designers, all owning & collaborating on multiple projects. As a member of the Personalization team, you will be surrounded by and encouraged to use world-class analytical, engineering, and machine learning techniques on big data to shape the evolution and scale of our personalization algorithms, metrics, and explanation. The Personalization team owns personalization signals affecting product ranking of Search, Browse, Autocomplete, and Recommendation experiences.

Challenges you will tackle

The primary focus of this job is to analyze, develop, and implement personalization signals in close collaboration with other great engineers from the Personalization team and other teams in the Data Science Chapter. The job can consist of, but is not limited to:


Creating user segments to analyze behaviors and provide insights to customers, enabling them to utilize this data for their own purposes, such as marketing campaigns
Improving the quality of our product discovery platform by developing new & improving current (ML / heuristic based) personalization signals
Defining user scenarios for personalization and shaping personalization metrics to track personalization improvements offline & online (in A/B tests)
Collaborate with technical and non-technical business partners to develop analytical dashboards that explain the impact of Personalization algorithms to stakeholders
Participate in strategic planning, brainstorming & prioritization sessions to improve personalization.



Requirements

Hard skills:


You have comprehensive understanding of classical machine learning techniques
You excel at Python, at least one ML/DL framework, have proficiency with any variant of SQL, and feel comfortable with the big data stack like Spark
You have delivered production ML systems and conducted A/B tests to validate their value
You can set hypotheses on data patterns and analyze the data to validate them
You strive to continuously learn and keep the track of the recent advancements in the field of AI and ML
Nice to have:
You have comprehensive knowledge of Natural Language Processing (NLP), especially transformer-based approaches is a plus
You have experience in Personalization algorithms used in ranking systems

Soft skills:


You have excellent English communication skills
You enjoy helping others around you grow as developers and be successful
You pick up new ideas and technologies quickly, love learning and talking to others about them
You have data-driven mindset with a passion for experimenting and using customer feedback to drive decision-making
Nice to have: you have experience collaborating in cross-functional teams



Benefits


Compensation: base range of 90-110k USD + stock options + work from home bonus
Fully remote team - choose where you live
Work from home stipend! We want you to have the resources you need to set up your home office
Apple laptops provided for new employees
Training and development budget for every employee, refreshed each year
Parental leave for qualified employees
Work with smart people who will help you grow and make a meaningful impact
Come along on our company retreat to the Canary Islands if you join before August 1!


Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion at Constructor

At Constructor.io we are committed to cultivating a work environment that is diverse, equitable, and inclusive. As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome individuals of all backgrounds and provide equal opportunities to all applicants regardless of their education, diversity of opinion, race, color, religion, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status or affiliation in any other protected group. Studies have shown that women and people of color may be less likely to apply for jobs unless they meet every one of the qualifications listed. Our primary interest is in finding the best candidate for the job. We encourage you to apply even if you don't meet all of our listed qualifications.
Show more

  • Creating user segments to analyze behaviors and provide insights to customers, enabling them to utilize this data for their own purposes, such as marketing campaigns
  • Improving the quality of our product discovery platform by developing new & improving current (ML / heuristic based) personalization signals
  • Defining user scenarios for personalization and shaping personalization metrics to track personalization improvements offline & online (in A/B tests)
  • Collaborate with technical and non-technical business partners to develop analytical dashboards that explain the impact of Personalization algorithms to stakeholders
  • Participate in strategic planning, brainstorming & prioritization sessions to improve personalization.


Requirements

Hard skills:

  • You have comprehensive understanding of classical machine learning techniques
  • You excel at Python, at least one ML/DL framework, have proficiency with any variant of SQL, and feel comfortable with the big data stack like Spark
  • You have delivered production ML systems and conducted A/B tests to validate their value
  • You can set hypotheses on data patterns and analyze the data to validate them
  • You strive to continuously learn and keep the track of the recent advancements in the field of AI and ML
  • Nice to have:
    • You have comprehensive knowledge of Natural Language Processing (NLP), especially transformer-based approaches is a plus
    • You have experience in Personalization algorithms used in ranking systems
Soft skills:

  • You have excellent English communication skills
  • You enjoy helping others around you grow as developers and be successful
  • You pick up new ideas and technologies quickly, love learning and talking to others about them
  • You have data-driven mindset with a passion for experimenting and using customer feedback to drive decision-making
  • Nice to have: you have experience collaborating in cross-functional teams


Benefits

  • Compensation: base range of 90-110k USD + stock options + work from home bonus
  • Fully remote team - choose where you live
  • Work from home stipend! We want you to have the resources you need to set up your home office
  • Apple laptops provided for new employees
  • Training and development budget for every employee, refreshed each year
  • Parental leave for qualified employees
  • Work with smart people who will help you grow and make a meaningful impact
  • Come along on our company retreat to the Canary Islands if you join before August 1!

Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion at Constructor

At Constructor.io we are committed to cultivating a work environment that is diverse, equitable, and inclusive. As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome individuals of all backgrounds and provide equal opportunities to all applicants regardless of their education, diversity of opinion, race, color, religion, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status or affiliation in any other protected group. Studies have shown that women and people of color may be less likely to apply for jobs unless they meet every one of the qualifications listed. Our primary interest is in finding the best candidate for the job. We encourage you to apply even if you don't meet all of our listed qualifications.

Title: Data Scientist (Credit)
Description:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, more freedom. And since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. With an arsenal of awesome products that span spending, saving, travel, transfers, investing, exchanging and more, we've helped 45+ million customers get more from their money. And we're not done yet.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‌ two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. We've been officially certified as a Great Place to Work™ in recognition of our outstanding employee experience! So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else – with class, logical thinking, and lots of style 😎 Let’s break it down: we take the most complex problems and create tailor-made solutions for our customers 🚀 If you’re thinking the Data team is kept in some sort of a secret den, doomed to never see the impact of their work, don’t worry - that’s not how we do things. They’re some of our best and brightest problem-solvers, deployed to the front lines to work in product teams and deliver rockstar solutions 🤘

We start with deep data analysis to understand our customers, their objectives and any issues they might have. We then use various data points and advanced machine learning algorithms, to come up with the best possible option for each client. We experiment, iterate, and build fully automated solutions, based on algorithms which self-improve with time.

We’re looking for next-level Data Scientists to board our FinTech rocket ship and shape the future of financial services apps. Phew! It’s a big task, but you won’t do it alone. 💪

You’ll be working with the toughest and most gifted professionals in Product, Design, Data Science and Engineering, on impactful projects that’ll make our company move forward ⏩

What You’ll Be Doing


Building models for full Retail Credit lifecycle
Improving existing algorithms and building new Proofs of Concept
Delivering real impact to the product through rigorous data-driven solutions
Researching and then delivering PoCs into data products
Collaborating with product owners, engineers, and data scientists to continually solve complex data problems


What You'll Need


Experience working in a data science team of a credit institution
A Bachelor's/Master's/PhD in STEM (Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering)
Excellent knowledge of data science tools, including, python coding, SQL and production tools
A deep understanding of probability and statistics fundamentals
A big-picture mindset to correctly diagnose problems, produce research, and discover solutions
Excellent communication and collaboration skills to partner with Product Owners and business heads


Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Refer to our <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Data Privacy Statement for Candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Si eres una persona dinámica, entusiasta y quieres formar parte de proyectos internacionales, esta es tu oportunidad!







El Grupo Axactor, busca un/a Data Scientist para su equipo de Business Strategy en sus oficinas de Madrid (100% presencial).







¿Cuáles serán tus funciones?




· Gestión integral del proceso completo de un analítica, desde el desarrollo y gestión de modelos de Machine Learning, hasta automatizar ETL, modificar, transformar y explotar datos, para hacer una exploración y estadística de la calidad del dato.

· Interacción permanente con BI/Operaciones/Negocio para definir objetivos, evaluaciones y nuevos modelos.

· Liderar las innovaciones en materia de datos y a ofrecer nuevas y diferentes perspectivas de análisis de datos al negocio basadas en los datos.

· Trabajará con BBDD relacionales para tratar los datos, realizar análisis en R/Python, automatizar procesos de datos y, finalmente, calcular e interpretar evaluaciones.




¿Qué requisitos necesitas?




· Formación universitaria en Ingeniería Informática o Telecomunicaciones, Estadística, Matemáticas.

· 3 a 5 años de experiencia como Data Scientist o puesto similar como Data Engineering o BI Analyst.

· Valorable experiencia en el sector bancario y/o financiero realizando funciones de forecast.

· Nivel avanzado de SQL.

· Nivel avanzado de R/Python y Machine Learning.




¿Qué habilidades buscamos?




· Inglés: nivel avanzado.

· Habilidades comunicativas.

· Pensamiento lógico y analítico.

· Persona con capacidad de adaptación a situaciones cambiantes.

· Alto sentido de la responsabilidad y agilidad en la gestión de gran volumen de trabajo.

· Orientación a resultados y atención a los detalles.




¿Qué ofrecemos?




· Proyectos internacionales y desafiantes dentro de un Grupo de 6 países.

· Ambiente de trabajo colaborativo.

· Paquete de remuneración competitivo.

· Flexibilidad horaria.







Pasión, Confianza y Proactividad, son los valores que nos definen.




¿Te unes al reto Axactor?

Show more

Title: DATA SCIENTIST AND MACHINE LEARNING ENGINEER - Energy and Food
Description:
Are you ready to embark on a challenging journey of discovering and applying novel Machine Learning and AI-driven solutions in trending topics including energy optimization in microgrids with renewable energies and electric vehicle, interoperable digital twins for advanced monitoring and management of assets or novel technologies to contribute to better practices in the agricultural sector?

The Applied Artificial Intelligence Unit of EURECAT is looking for a highly motivated Data Scientist and Machine Learning engineer to help us pave the way in digitalization and development of new technologies for creating a smarter and more sustainable future.

Responsabilities

As a valued member of our team, your role encompasses several critical dimensions:


Design and implement solutions based on mathematical algorithms and classical ML: supervised and unsupervised models, regression models, classification, clustering, dimensionality reduction, optimization, recommendation systems, time series, semi-supervised learning, etc.
Design and implement solutions based on Deep Learning techniques like Recurrent Neural Networks and Autoencoders.
Research innovative techniques and methods in the field of artificial intelligence to stay up-to-date with new trends.
Practical application and experimentation of state-of-the-art techniques in projects and challenges to be developed.
Global Impact: Collaborate on scientific publications, sharing your insights with the wider research community.
Tailored Growth: We recognize your unique strengths and interests. Your responsibilities will evolve accordingly, fostering personalized development within our team.
Project Leadership: As you grow and the projects unfold, your adept project management skills will steer us toward success.



WHAT EURECAT CAN OFFER YOU?

Our group is specialized in applied research and development on ML and AI solutions. The Applied Artificial Intelligence Unit of Eurecat develops innovative solutions (algorithms, methods, platforms) based on a combination of artificial intelligence and knowledge management technologies, especially for the industrial, energy and sustainability sectors. We have over 12 years of experience pushing the adoption of state-of-the-art AI and ML solutions for our private customers as well as for relevant European research projects! Check out our portfolio:

Applied Artificial Intelligence - Eurecat (applied-artificial-intelligence-eurecat.github.io)

Applied Artificial Intelligence Eurecat Technological Centre

And …


Permanent contract
Hybrid work (3 home office/2 work in the office)
Flexible Schedule
Shorter workday on Friday and Summer Schedule
Flexible remuneration package (health insurance, transport, lunch, studies - training and kindergarten)
Eurecat workers can join the Eurecat Academy courses
Eurecat workers can attend to our weekly thematic sessions to be aware of Eurecat areas of knowledge.
Language’s training (English, Catalan and Spanish)



Requirements:


Passion for DataScience and ML.
Basic studies: Physics, Math, Energy engineering, Agronomy, Forestry engineering.
Superior studies: MSc or equivalent in ML, AI, Computer Vision, or a related field.
Hands-on experience with Machine Learning, Deep Learning, with a track record of applying AI techniques.
Proficiency in Python and knowledge of basic libraries like Numpy, Pandas, Matplotlib, Scikit-Learn, SciPy.
Knowledge of mathematical optimization and its implementation in python with libraries like Pyomo or PuLP.
Valuable knowledge in some deep learning libraries like Keras, PyTorch and Tensorflow.
Open minded and multidisciplinary: Eager to learn new domains.
Dynamic communication skills, allowing you to effectively convey complex ideas and collaborate with colleagues from diverse backgrounds.
A readiness to travel when needed, embracing opportunities to connect with clients, partners, and collaborators worldwide.
Languages: English, Catalan, Spanish
Show more

Title: Junior AI Engineer
Description:
Ubicación:

Madrid, ES, 28046

Fecha: 16 jun. 2024

¿Eres únic@?

Entonces eres KPMG Originals. Un modo de entender la vida y tu profesión diferente desde donde marcar la diferencia. Un modo de crecer en un ambiente profesional que busca cambiar las cosas, transformar las empresas y la sociedad.

Ven, alcanza tus metas, supera tus límites en un ambiente profesional único y únete a una firma que es más que una firma de Servicios Profesionales. Sé KPMG Originals.

¿Qué podrás hacer?

Desde el equipo de LIGHTHOUSE, nuestra área de Data & Analytics, ayudamos a nuestros clientes a encontrar la eficiencia y el alto rendimiento en todas sus funciones TIC, tanto internas como externas hacia sus unidades de negocio y proveedores: buscando la máxima eficiencia en la operación de sus servicios y ajustando sus costes; así como incrementando su trascendencia en la cuenta de resultados y facilitando la innovación.

Actualmente, nos encontramos ampliando el equipo con un/a perfil Junior con experienica en proyectos de Inteligencia Artificial.

¿Qué necesitas saber?


Tener 1-2 años de experiencia laboral
Título universitario en Ciencias de la Computación, Ingeniería, Matemáticas u otro campo relacionado.
Experiencia en el desarrollo / configuración de modelos de IA generativa y/o LLM, deseable experiencia / certificación en servicios Azure OpenAI
Habilidad de programación en lenguajes como Python.
Experiencia en el manejo de grandes conjuntos de datos y en el procesamiento de datos para tareas de IA.
Capacidad de colaborar de manera efectiva en un entorno interdisciplinario.


¿Qué valor añadido te podemos aportar?


Un gran ambiente de trabajo, tanto dentro como fuera de la oficina
Oportunidades internacionales y red de contactos global
Formacióncontinuay plan de carrera a tu medida
Salario competitivo y plan de remuneración flexible
31 días laborables de vacaciones
La tarde de tu cumpleaños libre
Flexibilidad y posibilidad de teletrabajo
Acceso a Kteam, nuestra plataforma de bienestar, servicios, solidaridad y promociones
Los beneficios pueden variar para programas de becas y/o prácticas


Nuestro compromiso en KPMG es promover ambientes de trabajo en los que se trate con respeto y dignidad a las personas, garantizando la igualdad de oportunidades en su selección, formación y promoción ofreciendo un entorno de trabajo libre de cualquier discriminación por motivo de género, edad, discapacidad, orientación sexual, identidad o expresión de género, religión, etnia, estado civil o cualquier otra circunstancia personal o social. Y es que cada persona tiene un valor único y especial que aportar a la firma.

Nuestros valores marcan la diferencia. Marca la diferencia, impulsa tu talento.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Sobre la Empresa:

Factorenergia es una empresa consolidada en el sector de la electricidad, el gas y las energías renovables con más de 250.000 clientes en España. Actualmente estamos buscando un Científico de Datos con experiencia en la herramienta LLM y conocimientos de Git para nuestras oficinas en Barcelona (Av. Diagonal 575 - Edificio CC L'ILLA DIAGONAL).




Responsabilidades:




Planificar y ejecutar varios proyectos de ciencia de datos según la demanda.
Desarrollar algoritmos utilizando y optimizando LLM (como ChatGPT).
Análisis de datos: procesos de transformación, segmentación y análisis de datos.
Identificar información valiosa a través de la gestión efectiva de los datos.




Requisitos:




Buscamos candidatos/as con título universitario en Ciencia de Datos u otras áreas relacionadas y amplia experiencia en aprendizaje automático. El candidato ideal debería tener excelentes habilidades analíticas, conocimientos de bases de datos SQL, habilidades interpersonales y conocimientos de Git.




Habilidades técnicas:




Aprendizaje automático
Herramientas LLM como ChatGPT
SQL Server
Git
Experiencia de desarrollo con Python




Ofrecemos:




Salario competitivo basado en habilidades y experiencia.
Proyecto estable con oportunidades de crecimiento.
Equipo de trabajo multidisciplinario y excelente ambiente laboral.
Viernes intensivos todo el año hasta las 15 hs.
Posibilidad de realizar modalidad de trabajo híbrido (casa-oficina); Superado el período de evaluación.
Descuento especial en la Luz & Gas para trabajadores de Factorenergia.

  • Salario competitivo basado en habilidades y experiencia.
  • Proyecto estable con oportunidades de crecimiento.
  • Equipo de trabajo multidisciplinario y excelente ambiente laboral.
  • Viernes intensivos todo el año hasta las 15 hs.
  • Posibilidad de realizar modalidad de trabajo híbrido (casa-oficina); Superado el período de evaluación.
  • Descuento especial en la Luz & Gas para trabajadores de Factorenergia.

Title: Científico/a de datos
Place: Las Palmas de Gran Canaria, Canary Islands, Spain
Description:
¿Quieres un desafío profesional en una consultora IT de primer nivel? ¡Esta es tu oportunidad! En Intelequia, nos encontramos en búsqueda de talento innovador y apasionado por las tecnologías de vanguardia para unirse a nuestro equipo.




Con más de 15 años de experiencia en el sector y reconocidos como una de las mejores empresas de tecnología para trabajar en España, según Great Place To Work, estamos especializados en realizar servicios TIC en la nube operando a nivel nacional e internacional, abarcando áreas como Infraestructura, Ciberseguridad, Inteligencia Artificial y Desarrollos en .NET y Low Code.




Nuestra misión es acompañar a nuestros clientes en cada etapa de sus proyectos de IT, liderando sus iniciativas y ofreciendo soluciones punteras que impulsen su crecimiento y eficiencia en un entorno tecnológico cada vez más competitivo.




Si estás dispuesto a asumir nuevos retos y formar parte de un equipo comprometido con la excelencia, ¡queremos conocerte!




¿QUÉ BUSCAMOS?

Un/a Data Scientist, con al menos 2 años de experiencia en el sector.




FUNCIONES

Realizar análisis exploratorios de datos para comprender los patrones y tendencias de los datos.
Construir y entrenar modelos de machine learning para resolver problemas de negocio y predecir resultados.
Implementar modelos de machine learning en sistemas de producción.
Interpretar y comunicar los resultados del análisis de datos a stakeholders técnicos y no técnicos.
Mantenerse actualizado sobre las últimas técnicas y herramientas de ciencia de datos.




REQUISITOS MÍNIMOS

Formación en Ingeniería Técnica/Informática o similares.
Valorable estar en posición de master
Conocimientos en Python o R.
Conocimientos sólidos en estadística y técnicas de machine learning.
Experiencia con bibliotecas de machine learning populares (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-Learn).
Habilidades de visualización de datos para comunicar resultados de forma clara y efectiva (Matplotlib, Seaborn, Plotly).
Excelentes habilidades de comunicación y colaboración.
Capacidad para trabajar de forma independiente y como parte de un equipo.
Orientación a los detalles y capacidad para resolver problemas.




En Intelequia creemos firmemente que la felicidad de nuestro equipo influye directamente en el trabajo realizado, para ello TE OFRECEMOS:




Incorporación inmediata a un PROYECTO ILUSIONANTE Y MOTIVADOR.
Formación continua para desarrollo profesional: idiomas, certificaciones, competencias profesionales, etc.
Trabajo en modelo híbrido donde puedes trabajar 3 días a la semana en casa.
Buen clima laboral, formando parte de un equipo de grandes profesionales donde poder crecer y aportar
Trabajar en una empresa Great Place to Work

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer

Customer Facing

Remote, Europe




Join a team where your work with AI makes a real difference. Be part of a supportive culture that values collaboration and impactful work.




Role Overview: As a Machine Learning Engineer, you'll work closely with the commercial team to provide technical expertise and tailor solutions to meet customer needs. You'll participate in conferences, gather customer feedback, and ensure technical wins.




We'd love to hear from you if you have the following skills:

Strong technical background in ML, deep learning workflows, and Python.
Experience with cloud technologies, particularly AWS.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and travel occasionally.
Cloud/ML and experience with enterprise-level customers.




Company Culture and Benefits:

Remote-first company with occasional in-person gatherings.
Stipend for a co-working space.
Equity-based compensation.




Interview Process:

CV Screening.
Technical Deep Dive.
Collaboration and Team Fit Interviews.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We are looking for a talented Data scientist to join and change the world of advertising together, as we are developing the most sophisticated and intelligent AdExchange for our brands and publishers. Are you the one?




Who are we?




We are a scale-up in a 📈 hyper-growth phase so we need to ensure that our product can scale up, and we need your 🧠 brain for this!




On the contextual side, by combining Natural Language Processing and Computer Vision, our proprietary Machine Learning-based technology provides a human-like understanding of the content of the web. We find the best context for each ad, while providing unparalleled risk-mitigation capabilities that protect advertisers from showing their ads on pages that could be damaging to their brand. All of this, without relying on cookies or any other tracking mechanisms.




On the AdExchange side, we are creating the most efficient exchange in the market by combining Optimization, Unsupervised, and Reinforcement Learning techniques. We put together the most valuable sources of demand and supply. From our Floor Strategy on the channel side to our Header Bidding solution at the preBid connector, the AdExchange becomes smarter every day.

We want you to 💡 innovate and we have plenty of space for you to develop professionally!




As leaders of ⚙️ Contextual Advertising Technologies; at Seedtag, our goal is to promote a better advertising industry where effective advertising respects users' privacy and experience.




Key Figures




2014 · Founded

2018 · 16M€ total turnover getting growth and going international

2021 · Raised 40M€ , 230 Seedtaggers in 10 countries

2022 · Raised 250M€ , expanding into the U.S market

👉 2024 · Where will you bring us? 😎




What are our challenges?

…in numbers 🤯:

We handle more than 180 billion of events per day
We process on average 600,000 web pages per hour
Our CDN serves 1.5 petabytes every month to 200 million devices worldwide

So... it’s all about 🏎️ speed and infrastructure reliance.

Your 😎 mission (if you accept it) is to make our platform more intelligent.




Your Challenge: build the intelligence of our AdExchange

The AdExchange is the space where supply opportunities (ad slots) are matched to advertising demand items (ads). Just like the former trading pits in the stock market, opportunities to sell and buy are constantly created and resolved.




To make the most of this flow of monetization opportunities, we develop, train and deploy different Machine Learning models. At our AdExhange, you will find a myriad of use cases, each requiring different mathematical and infrastructure solutions. Our approach is strongly product-oriented, with a firm mathematical basis and proficient software development practices.




You will work close to the production environment and hand-to-hand with the team’s Data Scientists, MLOps and Data engineers, getting immediate feedback on the response of your solution. From your head to the cluster, you will have a barrier-free highway and a proactive team around you to support your work and ideas.




🚀 This is a high-impact project that will shape the future of Seedtag.
🕵🏻 You will work identifying, exploring, and making sense of data sources.
🧑‍💼 You will partner closely with the Data component of our squad, to enhance the delivery of the intelligence into the AdExchange.
⚙️ You will develop machine learning solutions to solve business problems: anomaly detection, price optimization, etc.
💻 You will develop and deploy production-oriented data software.




If you are up to the challenge and want to be a part of a talented and passionate team, we encourage you to apply for this position.




Our core values




🎯 Outcome over output

Our core tech values reflect our commitment to delivering exceptional results, fostering a culture of continuous learning, and always putting the customer's needs first. We believe that success comes from focusing on the outcomes rather than just the output. Our tech team aims to solve problems that make a meaningful difference, and we measure our success by the impact we have on the customer.




💡Failure is allowed, learning is a must

We also recognize that failure is an inevitable part of the innovation process. Our team understands that setbacks are opportunities to learn and grow. We believe in testing early and often, and we continuously iterate and improve until we arrive at the best solution.




👨‍👩‍👧‍👦 We are all scouts

Another core value we hold is that we are all scouts. We believe in leaving things better than we found them. This means we take ownership of our work and strive to improve the systems and processes we touch. We encourage our team members to be proactive in identifying areas for improvement, and we value those who take the initiative to implement positive changes. Our goal is to leave a lasting, positive impact on our projects and our team.




📊 We are data-driven

Lastly, our team is data-driven. We believe that making informed decisions based on data is crucial to our success. Our engineering team uses data to guide our decision-making process and to identify opportunities for improvement. We are committed to using data to continuously monitor and optimize our systems and processes to ensure that we are delivering the best possible outcome for our customers.




How do we work?

Our modelling stack consists of a series of well-stablished Python frameworks such as Scikit Learn/Spacy/Torch/Tensorflow, but we embrace the adoption of new cool tools.

Our backend consists of a series of containerized (Docker) microservices built in Python, and deployed in a Kubernetes cluster.




Our MLOps infrastructure is built upon MLFlow and DVC to track, trace and register the models, the metrics, and the data. We love automatizing things, and our deployments are triggered via Jenkins for the code, and MLFlow for the models. Every service API we build is self-managed, so that you can fine-tune every detail of the serving process.




Our cloud infrastructure runs on Google Cloud. We store data in Redis, MongoDB, ElasticSearch, GCS, and other storage systems. We love kafka, event-based and data-streaming architecture models.




You Will Succeed If:

🚀 You have 4-5 years of solid experience in data science and machine learning.
🧐 You (preferentially) have a degree in computer science, engineering, statistics, mathematics, physics or another degree with a strong quantitative component.
📐You understand the theoretical functioning of the main algorithms in ML and you have experience applying these to real problems.
⚙️ You care about producing maintainable code over time using good programming practices. you have experience in testing and with CI/CD tools.
🌟 Nice to have: you have experience deploying models into production with docker and kubernetes. You are familiar with the MLOps universe.
🛠️ You have ample experience with one or more of these machine learning tools: Scikit-learn, Tensorflow, PyTorch, etc.
🤔 You are a big-picture thinker who can see the forest and the trees. You have a strong understanding of the technical and business requirements of the projects you work on, and you can think strategically to ensure that your work aligns with the goals of the company.
💡 You are a problem solver who loves a good challenge. You are energized by tackling complex technical problems and figuring out creative solutions.
📚 You are a continuous learner who is passionate about your craft. You are committed to staying up-to-date with the latest developments in back-end engineering and are always looking for ways to improve your skills and knowledge.
🤝 You are a strong communicator who can work effectively in a team. You are comfortable working collaboratively with others, and you are able to effectively communicate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
🏎️ You are adaptable and flexible. You are comfortable working in a dynamic, fast-paced environment, and you are able to adjust to changing priorities and requirements.

If you possess these qualities and are excited about the opportunity to work on challenging, high-impact projects with a talented and passionate team, we encourage you to apply for this position.




What else is cool at Seedtag ?

🌏 Unlimited work from home
⌛ Excellent work/life balance
🏳️‍🌈 Harassment-free, supportive and safe environment to ensure the healthiest and friendliest professional experience fostering diversity at all level
💻 Latest Macbook Pro + 🏠 1,000€ for your home setup
💼 Mentoring and Career development with learning budget
🍽️🚘👶 Restaurant, transports and kindergarten tickets
🏥 Medical insurance discounts

… but there is more !

Free 🇬🇧 English / 🇪🇸 Spanish / 🇫🇷 French lessons
🏉 Paid travel to our HQ in Madrid to gather with your teams
🥳 Paid offsite meetup with your team, yearly company gathering,🎄Christmas events…
💯 "One Seedtag": a special award which allows you to work for a month from any of our open offices with paid travel and accommodation (think of Brazil, Mexico..., 🏖)




It's really a 🚀 key moment to jump in the bandwagon with us and join the Seedtag 🥾 adventure! If you are interested in joining one of the fastest growing 📈 startups in Europe and work on massive scalability challenges, this is the place for you.

Title: Data Scientist: Fraud Detection
Description:
Únete como Data Scientist: Fraud Detection a una compañía de elevada reputación en el sector del comercio omnicanal, donde tu principal función será desarrollar e implementar herramientas para detección de fraudes internos, contribuyendo a la mejora del funcionamiento de la empresa.

¿Cuáles serán tus principales funciones?:

Desarrollar e implementar herramienta para la detección de fraudes internos.
Monitorizar parte de la actividad para establecer alertas de posibles fraudes e incumplimientos.
Detectar incidencias en el sistema interno para prevenirlas.
Ayudar en las investigaciones internas de los Responsables de Control Interno a través del dato.
Desarrollar los proyectos del área de IA y robótica.
Parametrizar y gestionar la herramienta de autocontrol del grupo, automatizándola para ganar productividad en las tiendas.
Participar de manera activa en proyectos transversales.

¿Qué necesitamos de ti?

Formación académica en informática, matemática, ingeniería o relacionada.
Mínimo 3 años de experiencia en implementación de nuevas herramientas el área de Análisis de Datos, Auditorías o afines.
Conocimientos avanzados de Excel, técnicas analíticas y herramientas de visualización de datos.
Manejo del idioma inglés (B2).
Interés por la detección de fraudes.
Productividad, autonomia y organización.

Por ultimo, pero no menos importante, ofrecemos:

Ambiente laboral dinámico y colaborativo con oportunidades de desarrollo profesional.
Contrato indefinido con remuneración competitiva acorde a la experiencia y responsabilidades.
Horario de trabajo flexible para promover el equilibrio entre vida laboral y personal.
Formación continua y acceso a recursos de aprendizaje.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
RightHand, compañía especializada en atracción del talento y contratación, estamos colaborando con nuestro cliente, agencia especializada en consultoría y soluciones estratégicas, siempre bajo el amparo de los datos y de su amplia experiencia en creatividad, logran crear proyectos innovadores que llevan a las empresas al siguiente nivel. Buscamos un Data Scientist en Madrid, para un rol dinámico y desafiante, en el que serás responsable de liderar la analítica de datos que permita impulsar el crecimiento de las ventas, mejorar el compromiso del cliente y generen resultados medibles. Además, colaborarás estrechamente con los equipos de SEO y personalización y atenderás las necesidades puntuales de analítica de datos en los diferentes equipos.







Funciones:




Serás el responsable de los datos, el estratega digital y el enlace de la agencia con el cliente.
Analizarás a fondo los datos de marketing, extrayendo insights valiosos sobre el comportamiento del usuario, las tendencias del mercado y las oportunidades de mejora.
Para este perfil será necesario un sólido conocimiento en SQL, Python, Spark y Apache Airflow.
Manejo de Machine Learning para identificar patrones en datos masivos y elaborar predicciones.
Desarrollarás e implementarás estrategias digitales integrales que alineen con los objetivos generales de la empresa, considerando las diferentes plataformas y canales digitales, incluyendo la colaboración con los equipos de SEO y personalización de la agencia.
Gestionarás y optimizarás campañas digitales en diversos canales, incluyendo Paid media, SEO, CRM y cualquier otro canal que resulte relevante.
Realizarás investigaciones de mercado y análisis de la competencia para informar las estrategias digitales, identificando las mejores prácticas del sector y las oportunidades para destacar precios, productos, promociones y ofertas.
Crearás informes y presentaciones convincentes que comuniquen de manera clara y efectiva el rendimiento de las campañas digitales a las partes interesadas, utilizando herramientas de visualización de datos.
Serás el punto de contacto con los equipos de SEO y personalización de la agencia con él cliente, asegurando una colaboración fluida y efectiva en proyectos conjuntos a lo largo de los diferentes lanzamientos de producto.
Colaborarás estrechamente con otros equipos de marketing, ventas y producto para desarrollar e implementar iniciativas digitales exitosas, aportando tu visión estratégica y analítica.
Serás un punto de referencia para otros miembros del equipo en materia de análisis digital y marketing online, compartiendo tu conocimiento y experiencia.
Recomendarás mejoras en los procesos y herramientas digitales, buscando siempre la optimización y la eficiencia.
Contribuirás a la creación de una cultura de datos en la empresa, promoviendo el uso de datos en cada plataforma para la toma de decisiones informadas.
Utilizarás tus habilidades analíticas para identificar oportunidades de mejora en el rendimiento del sitio web, las campañas de marketing y la experiencia del cliente.
Desarrollarás modelos de atribución para medir el impacto de las diferentes actividades de marketing digital.
Segmentarás las audiencias objetivo para crear campañas personalizadas y más efectivas.
Realizarás pruebas A/B para optimizar la conversión en el sitio web.







¿Qué ofrecemos?




🌱Trabaja en un entorno en crecimiento, enfocado a crear e innovar con equipos multidisciplinares y multiculturales en Creatividad, Digital Performance, Retail, Data y Tecnología.

✍️Posición Estable: Contrato indefinido porque queremos que formes parte y puedas desarrollarte con nosotros.

💸Salario: A negociar en función de la experiencia. Bonificación por desempeño.

📖Oportunidades de formación interna.

❤️Social Beneficios: Tickets Restaurante y Seguro Médico.

🕛Horario de lunes a jueves de 09:00-18:15 y viernes de 09:00-15:00. Julio y Agosto, tenemos jornada intensiva, de lunes a viernes de 8:00 - 15:00.

💻Modelo de trabajo híbrido.

🏖️22 días de vacaciones anuales, más 24 y 31 de diciembre y Día de la Publicidad.

💰Posibilidad de incentivo por captación de nuevos clientes y nuevos empleados. ¡Ayúdanos a seguir creciendo!




Si cumples con los requisitos y estás listo para un nuevo desafío en tu carrera, ¡esperamos recibir tu aplicación!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Do you want to drive the next urban revolution? At Cabify, that’s what we’re doing. We aim to make cities better places to live by improving mobility for the people living in them, connecting riders to drivers at the touch of a button. Maybe one day cities will be places where nobody needs a private car. But we’ve still got a long way to go… want to be part of this journey?

About The Position

You will join Cabify’s Data Science team, a group of highly motivated specialists with access to all data within the organization. The team is involved in all main areas of the company, including vehicle and route management, understanding user experience, pricing, fraud detection, and marketing optimization (see for yourself: exhibit A , exhibit B , exhibit C ) . You will work with state-of-the-art tools and infrastructure to help improve everyday operations in more than 40 cities worldwide. Cabify's Data Science team provides a unique opportunity to not only test and learn but also implement great ideas that will shape the future of our cities.

As a Data Scientist In Our Team, You Will


Develop high-impact data science projects, working closely with other data, engineering, product and business teams.
Participate in the results analysis of real-life experiments, following academy-standard scientific methods and procedures, to demonstrate the impact of the new product features we develop.
Develop new machine-learning models.
Help to convert the team’s technical knowledge into real and tangible business insights that bring value to the company.
Join product development conversations, discussing new features and bringing the data science perspective to everything we build.


What we’re looking for


At least 3 years of professional experience working as a data scientist or equivalent research role.
Strong educational background, e.g Masters in Computer Science, Physics, Engineering, Mathematics, Economics, etc.
Solid foundations in Probability & Statistics.
Experience working with Python for data analysis and data visualization libraries.
Experience with data extraction and processing. Capable of writing complex SQL code.
Ability to work autonomously in an unstructured environment.


Bonus Points


Experience bringing machine learning to production, with all its subtleties: deploying, training, testing, model degradation, model serving, etc.
Experience with state-of-the-art methods in topics like deep learning models, time series analysis, bayesian statistics, causal inference, etc.
Experience with geo data modeling, analysis and visualization.


What’s it like to work at Cabify?

We’re a Company Full Of Happy, Motivated People And We Never Want That To Change. Here Are Some More Reasons Why It Rocks To Be Part Of Our High-performance Team


💶Excellent Salary conditions: Individual Contributor L3 [38-53K€]
🏝️Recharge days! (10 Free Fridays annually)
🌍Our office is located in Madrid.
⌚Flexible work environment & hours.
🙌Regular team events.
🚗Cabify staff free rides.
🚀Personal development programs based on our career paths.
📐Coursera: your own license in Coursera to take as many courses as you wish and continue developing your skills.
🧘‍♀️ iFeel: Free access to the iFeel platform, so you can take care of your emotional well-being through therapy sessions.
💳Flexible compensation plan: Restaurant tickets, transport tickets, healthcare and childcare
🐱A pet room ,so you don’t have to leave your furry friend at home
☕️And last but not least...free coffee and fruit!


Cabify is proud of being an equal opportunity workplace. We celebrate diversity and we are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees regardless of background, gender, religion, orientation, age or ability. Join us!

Cabify is proud of being an equal opportunity workplace. We celebrate diversity and we are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees regardless of background, gender, religion, orientation, age or ability. Join us!

Title: Data Scientist
Place: Pozuelo de Alarcón, Community of Madrid, Spain
Description:
Sobre Zertia




Zertia es una startup pionera en la gestión de los riesgos asociados con el uso de modelos de Inteligencia Artificial en las empresas, aplicando una metodología exclusiva concebida con líderes en investigación de IA. Simultáneamente, las certificaciones de Zertia se adhieren a los estándares internacionales ISO y las certificaciones IEEE. Zertia asegura el cumplimiento normativo y la conformidad con los estándares internacionales en la aplicación de la Inteligencia Artificial.




¿Qué buscamos?




Estamos en la búsqueda de un Data Scientist apasionado y experimentado para unirse a nuestro equipo en una etapa crítica de crecimiento. El candidato ideal será un líder visionario con una sólida experiencia en ciencia de datos y un profundo conocimiento de las regulaciones de IA. Este rol es fundamental para el desarrollo de nuestros productos principales: modelos de evaluación de la conformidad y certificación que puedan aplicarse a modelos de IA en múltiples industrias y sean escalables.




Responsabilidades:




• Desarrollo de Productos: Diseñar y desarrollar modelos de evaluación de la conformidad y certificación de IA que cumplan con las normativas del EU IA Act y otras regulaciones y normas internacionales en la materia.

• Liderazgo Técnico: Dirigir y gestionar el equipo de ciencia de datos, promoviendo la innovación y el desarrollo de soluciones tecnológicas avanzadas.

• Colaboración Multidisciplinar: Trabajar estrechamente con los equipos de producto, regulación y tecnología, así como asesores externos para asegurar la alineación y cumplimiento de los objetivos estratégicos de la empresa.

• Escalabilidad: Garantizar que los modelos y soluciones desarrolladas sean escalables y adaptables a diversas industrias.

• Investigación y Desarrollo: Mantenerse actualizado con las últimas tendencias y avances en IA y ciencia de datos, y aplicarlos para mejorar nuestros productos y servicios.

• Cumplimiento Normativo: Asegurar que todos los modelos y soluciones cumplan con las regulaciones y estándares (éticos) internacionales y otras normas pertinentes.

• Liderazgo de personas: Liderar, guiar y desarrollar a los miembros del equipo, cuando los hubiere, en línea con los valores de la compañía.







Requisitos del puesto:




• Educación: Ciencias de Datos, Ingeniería, Matemáticas, Estadística, Informática o un campo relacionado.

• Experiencia: Mínimo de 8 años de experiencia en ciencia de datos o tecnologías de la información, con al menos 2 años relacionados con IA y 3 años en un rol de liderazgo.

• Conocimientos Técnicos: Experiencia demostrable en el desarrollo y validación de modelos de IA, incluyendo técnicas de machine learning y deep learning.

• Conocimientos Sectoriales: Relevantes a industria(/s) que sean o puedan ser clientes de Zertia: terminología, procesos, tecnologías y riesgos relevantes de dicha industria, estructuras y governance de IA aplicable, políticas y requisitos de negocio para la gestión de IA, códigos de conducta y buenas prácticas, Además, procesos, estructuras, governance, funciones, documentación, jerarquías, monitorización, análisis y evaluación relacionada con la gestión de sistemas de gestión de inteligencia artificial (AIMS), procesos de gestión de riesgos (en particular, conocimiento de ISO/IEC 23894), seguridad de información y datos así como evaluaciones de riesgo e impacto vinculadas a gestión de IA (en particular, ISO/IEC 22989, ISO/IEC 5259-3, ISO/IEC TR 24027:2021, ISO/IEC CD 42005, así como ISO/IEC 27001 y, donde aplique, ISO/IEC 27701).

• Regulación de IA: Conocimiento profundo de las regulaciones de IA, particularmente el EU IA Act y normativas similares en Estados Unidos y el Reino Unido.

• Habilidades de Liderazgo: Capacidad para liderar y gestionar equipos multidisciplinarios, fomentar la colaboración y promover una cultura de innovación.

• Habilidades de Comunicación: Excelentes habilidades de comunicación verbal y escrita, con capacidad para explicar conceptos técnicos complejos a audiencias no técnicas.

• Pensamiento Estratégico: Visión estratégica para alinear los desarrollos tecnológicos con los objetivos comerciales de la empresa.

• Idiomas: Fluidez en inglés y español.

• Proactividad y Autonomía: Capacidad para trabajar de manera independiente con mínima supervisión, siendo proactivo en la identificación y resolución de problemas relacionados con la gestión de la información.

• Afinidad Tecnológica: interés por las nuevas áreas de conocimiento. En particular, tecnologías disruptivas, IA generativa, etc.

• Actitud: proactiva y orientada a resultados, con un enfoque en la calidad y la eficiencia.

• Cooperación: Tienes una capacidad demostrada para navegar y forjar relaciones con terceros.

• Adaptación: Eres capaz de adaptarte rápidamente en un entorno de startup dinámico, aportando ideas frescas e innovadoras.




Qué ofrecemos:




Salario competitivo: según experiencia.

Impacto global y crecimiento: participa en proyectos a gran escala que redefinen industrias con clientes internacionales y de rápido crecimiento.

Cultura: trabaja con autonomía y colabora con un equipo amigable en un entorno de política de puertas abiertas y disfruta de eventos de equipo.

Otros: 23 días de vacaciones, ticket restaurante y seguro médico










Te animamos a postularte incluso si crees que no cumples con todos los requisitos. No todos los mejores candidatos cumplen con cada una de las calificaciones enumeradas. Si te apasiona la IA, cumples con gran parte de los requisitos anteriores y quieres unirte a una startup en rápido crecimiento, postúlate a esta oportunidad única.




Además, en Zertia nos comprometemos a crear un entorno de trabajo inclusivo y diverso. Creemos firmemente que la diversidad de experiencias, perspectivas y antecedentes es una fuente de fortaleza y enriquecimiento para nuestra comunidad laboral. Nos esforzamos por construir un equipo que refleje una variedad de identidades y experiencias, y fomentamos activamente la igualdad de oportunidades en todos nuestros procesos de reclutamiento y desarrollo profesional. Por ello, invitamos a candidatos de todos los orígenes a unirse a nosotros en nuestro compromiso de fomentar un ambiente de trabajo inclusivo y diverso.

Creemos firmemente que la diversidad de experiencias, perspectivas y antecedentes es una fuente de fortaleza y enriquecimiento para nuestra comunidad laboral. Nos esforzamos por construir un equipo que refleje una variedad de identidades y experiencias, y fomentamos activamente la igualdad de oportunidades en todos nuestros procesos de reclutamiento y desarrollo profesional. Por ello, invitamos a candidatos de todos los orígenes a unirse a nosotros en nuestro compromiso de fomentar un ambiente de trabajo inclusivo y diverso.

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
The Opportunity

As a Junior Data Scientist, you will be joining our Analytics department working on a hybrid basis in Madrid. This role requires a high degree of proficiency in both Spanish and English and we would invite you to submit your application in English.




You will play a crucial role in helping us achieve our goals and deliver success on behalf of our customers by building advanced statistical models and algorithms that infer and predict individual customer behaviours in real-time, based on retail, online and ecommerce transaction data.




We are experiencing a continued period of great success winning big deals with customers in Latin America, as well as across the EMEA region. This has been a big factor in our decision to build an Analytics presence in Spain to support our customers. For this role you will be working with global customers that require periodic work outside of standard hours (evening work) and international travel around once a quarter.




Day to Day

Applying analytical theory to diverse real-world problems on large and dynamic datasets
Generating integral work products from project kick-off through to live deployment
Contributing to the development of statistical models and algorithms for integration within Featurespace products
End-to-end processing and modelling of large customer data sets
Producing materials to feedback analytic output to customers (reports, presentations, visualizations)
Working collaboratively with customers to develop and optimize models tailored to their data
Evaluating and improving analytical results on live systems
Developing an understanding of industry data structures and processes
Working with engineering/development teams to support and enhance the analytical infrastructure
Testing analytical models and their integration within the ARIC platform




About you

Must haves:

Good degree in a scientific or numerate discipline (e.g. Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics, Engineering) or equivalent work experience
Strong, clear, concise written and verbal communication skills in both English and Spanish
Evidence of interest in machine learning
Experience in utilising statistical models and analytical algorithms in software
Experience using Python, Java, R or another major programming language for data analysis, machine learning or algorithm development
Technical and analytical skills with the ability to pick up new technologies and concepts quickly
Problem-solving skills (especially in data-centric applications)
Strong communication skills
Ability to manage and prioritise personal workload




Great to haves:

Exposure to the handling of large, diverse, real-world data sets
Experience working in a Linux command line environment
Experience using SQL to analyse data
Experience with version control software and workflows (e.g. git)




Equal Opportunities

Here at Featurespace we are committed to being a place of equality, inclusion and respect to provide a safe environment for you to bring your authentic self to work. We know that we gain as much strength from our differences as we do our similarities. We value diversity and are dedicated to listening and learning from each other to build and maintain a positive and productive culture. We appreciate this will be an ever-evolving focus for the business to ensure everyone feels supported and has a sense of belonging.

Title: Data Scientist - Risk Team
Description:
Thanks to our innovative BuyNow PayLater payment solution, Scalapay is transforming the way more than 5 million customers buy online and in-store, empowering 8,000+ merchants (online and in-store) to give their customers magical shopping experiences.

Being only 3 years old didn’t stop us from becoming a unicorn 🦄 We have raised over $700mln and we did this thanks to a team built around our 4 core values: #MakeItHappen #PlayAsATeam #StayCurious #FocusOnCustomer.

This is where your magic happens. If you love it, Scalapay it ♥

Are you passionate about leveraging data to drive informed decision-making and ensure the sustainable growth of a dynamic company? Join us as a Risk Data Scientist and contribute to shaping the core strategy of our business - the risk management.

You will be responsible for:


Develop, fine-tune, and deploy predictive algorithms using cutting-edge machine learning techniques and optimization models.
Work closely with our Risk decision analysts to create automated solutions that detect and mitigate emerging fraudulent trends.
Collaborate with the Product team to design experiments, analyse results, and extract actionable insights to enhance Scalapay's offerings. This will involve statistical modelling, correlation analysis and causal inference to understand behaviours inside the Scalapay product.
Stay ahead of the curve by staying updated on the latest technologies and industry trends.


You’ll be great for this role if:


You have at least 5 years of experience as a Data Scientist
Deep theoretical and applied knowledge in traditional machine learning, as well as knowledge in statistical inference, time series analysis and forecasting, or mathematical optimisation.
Extensive experience with the end-to-end model development cycle. Familiarity with orchestration tools and cloud infrastructures.
Excellent coding skills (SQL, Python/R)
Strong problem-solving abilities, with a knack for translating business challenges into data-driven hypotheses.
The ability to own and manage the entire data pipeline for your projects proactively.
Adaptability and change management skills to thrive in a fast-paced environment.
Exceptional communication skills in English, both written and verbal, to effectively convey complex ideas to diverse audiences.


Bonus Points for:


An advanced degree (MSc or PhD) in Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Operations Research, or related fields.
Experience in start-up environments, or in the Risk/Fraud domain.


Why you should join Scalapay:


Attractive packages based on skills and experience - the salary band we have for this position is of 60'000-70'000 € (Gross Annual Salary)
International environment with significant challenges to be met every day
Lots of opportunities to work with a team of industry tech leaders who are focused on delivering products that offer exceptional user experiences
Personalised support to accelerate your professional growth and take ownership of the products you deliver: we want to help you grow!
Latest technologies and being encouraged to bring your flair to the role.


Recruitment Process:


A quick chat with one of our Talent Acquisition team members
The first interview with the Hiring Manager to dive deep into your experiences and better understand your motivation
A case study to test your hard skills
A final chat with Simone, our CEO


Want to learn more? Don't hesitate to explore our Careers website , our LinkedIn and Glassdoor pages.

Pro tip: send your CV in English 😉

Super Pro tip: we know that application processes can be scary and frustrating but… we look for talent, not people that tick all our boxes.

We believe in the power of diversity: Scalapay is an Equal Opportunity Employer for any minority, disability, gender identity or sexual orientation.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Be part of something revolutionary

At o9 Solutions, our mission is clear: be the Most Valuable Platform (MVP) for enterprises. With our AI-driven platform — the o9 Digital Brain — we integrate global enterprises’ siloed planning capabilities, helping them capture millions and, in some cases, billions of dollars in value leakage. But our impact doesn’t stop there. Businesses that plan better and faster also reduce waste, which drives better outcomes for the planet, too.

We're on the lookout for the brightest, most committed individuals to join us on our mission. Along the journey, we’ll provide you with a nurturing environment where you can be part of something truly extraordinary and make a real difference for companies and the planet.

About the role

o9 Solutions is looking for an experienced, talented, and motivated Lead Data Scientist to come join our global team in NA or EMEA. As part of this Data Science team, you will be involved in the end-to-end delivery of our supply chain planning products and building advanced forecasting models with Predictive Analytics, Machine Learning and AI with algorithms such as R, and Python. These models will have used cases for Demand Planning, Supply Planning, Market Mix Modeling, Price Elasticity, New Product Planning, Store Assortment, Market Optimization, and more!

You will be key in understanding the customers supply chain problems, designing solutions, developing, and deploying models, validating, and maintaining those models.

A successful candidate will bring a Master’s in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering, and 5+ years of experience in hands-on modeling in R or Python, in a supply chain forecasting capacity. You will enjoy working directly with customers and our larger o9 Data Science team in India and NA.

What you’ll do for us:

Research, design, build, deploy, and validate new and existing machine learning models and predictive analytics for advanced forecasting in supply chain demand planning that will drive our customers growth from insights that are allow for better decision making
Apply a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, regression, neural nets, time series, optimizations etc.) to their real-world advantages/drawbacks for insights internally and externally
Collaborate with solution architects, business operations specialists, engineers, data scientists, product managers, and internal/external business teams to make sure the models are aligned with business objectives and customer needs
Develop machine learning models for segmentation and optimization
Provide visualization of complex data sets that includes mathematical models, algorithms, and robust analytics
Produce recommendations and use statistical techniques that answer key product questions
Provide on-going support for development of demand planning forecasting and predictive analysis.
Be a storyteller to explain the “why and how’” of your data driven recommendations to cross-functional teams and customers
Guide junior data scientists and oversee their activities to ensure proper alignment/execution of their activities, and maintain high coding standards and best practices within organization

What you’ll bring:

Experience: 5+ years of data science and data analytics experience.
5+ years’ experience in supply chain planning analysis that specialize in: Demand Planning, Predictive Analysis, Demand Forecasting, Supply Planning, Inventory Market Optimization, Store Segmentation, Market Mix Optimization, New Product Planning, or similar.
Experience in building scalable ML frameworks for demand sensing including identifying and collecting relevant input data, feature engineering, tuning, and testing.
Experience developing experimental and analytics plans for data modeling processes with the ability to accurately determine and resolve problems
Experience gathering data requirements for statistical predictive analytics research that drives market research, product innovation, and implementation in a supply chain space
Strong presentation and communications skills with ability to communicate complex analytical or technical concepts to audiences with limited analytical or technical background
Experience in time series forecasting in scale using heuristic based hierarchical best-fit models using algorithms like exponential smoothing, ARIMA, prophet and custom parameter tuning
Education: Master’s in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering, or related field
Skills: R, Python, Pyspark, Machine Learning, SQL, building models in platforms like Power BI or Tableau
Characteristics: You thrive in a fast paced, challenging environment, where this is much white space and problem solving is at the heart of what drives your analysis
We really value team spirit: Transparency and frequent communication is key. At o9, this is not limited by hierarchy, distance, or function

Preferred Experience…

Exposure to distributed data/computing tools: Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Gurobi, or related Big Data technologies
Experience with Deep Learning frameworks such as Keras, Tensorflow or PyTorch is preferable
Experience in implementing planning applications will be a plus

How the process works…

Apply by clicking the button below.
You’ll be contacted by our recruiter, who’ll fill you in on all things o9, give you some background about the role and get to know you. They’ll contact you either via video call or phone call - whatever you prefer.
During the interview phase, you will meet with the Hiring Manager for 30 minutes. The recruiter will contact you after the interview to let you know if we’d like to progress your application.
Your application has progressed! Meet with a new panel for a final round of interviews for 30 minutes each.
Our recruiter will let you know if you’re the successful candidate. Good luck!

More about us…

With the latest increase in our valuation from $1.1B to $3.7B, o9 Solutions is one of the fastest-growing technology companies in the world today. Our mission is to digitally transform planning and decision-making for the enterprise and the planet. Our culture is high-energy and drives us to aim 10x in everything we do.

Our platform, the o9 Digital Brain, is the premier AI-powered, cloud-native platform driving the digital transformations of major global enterprises including Google, Walmart, ABInBev, Starbucks, and many others.

Our headquarters are located in Dallas, with offices in Amsterdam, Paris, London, Barcelona, Madrid, Milan, Munich, Bangalore, Tokyo, Seoul, Sydney, Sao Paulo and Toronto.

o9 is an equal opportunity employer and seeks applicants of diverse backgrounds and hires without regard to race, colour, gender, religion, national origin, citizenship, age, sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by law

With the latest increase in our valuation from $1.1B to $3.7B, o9 Solutions is one of the fastest-growing technology companies in the world today.
