Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Wallapop is a Barcelona based scale-up driven by the purpose to empower people to embrace a more conscious and human way of consumption. We believe in a world where collaborative economy is mainstream. This is what drives us. 💫

Wallapop operates in Spain, Italy and Portugal, offering a catalogue of several hundreds of millions of products and services. Powered by technical innovation and continuous improvement, we bring together the scale & trust of classifieds with the marketplace's convenience & reach. 🌱 Our mission is to enable a connected trade ecosystem, making 2nd-hand the norm through smart use of technology.

Backed by top investors such as Accel, Insight Partners & Naver Corp we bring our total valuation to 690 million EUR and are embarking on our international journey with the aim to become the world's best unique goods trading platform.

The Challenge 🧩

The Wallapop platform generates tons of data and, with a mature data infrastructure already in place, the area of Data Science and Machine Learning is gaining momentum. The team is experiencing significant growth and, with many initiatives down the road, the opportunities are endless.

As a Data Scientist in the Wallapop Managed Marketplace Tribe, you will be working on the Data Science and Machine Learning initiatives aimed at improving the whole marketplace dynamics. This will include topics such as optimizing our Shipping and Logistics operations, fighting against fraud and contributing to the Trust & Safety of our platform, and improving the Customer Service user experience.

You will work closely with other Data Scientists, Product Managers, Engineers, UX Researchers, and Analysts to understand the product requirements and explore possible data and ML solutions. You will own the whole product lifecycle, from gathering the data needed to prototyping, building, evaluating, and iterating end-to-end solutions, all within Wallapop's Data and ML Platforms.

Additionally, you will have the opportunity to work on internal research projects, exploring new technologies and building PoCs that could ultimately become data products or insights, and be valuable for Wallapop.

You will be part of a growing Machine Learning team (7) within the Data & Analytics department (30+).

What You Will Do 👇


Take responsibility for the Data Science and ML initiatives within the Managed Marketplace Tribe
Work with multidisciplinary Product teams to identify opportunities and gather requirements (both in terms of product and tech).
Work with Data Scientists, ML Engineers and Software Engineers to explore and build the best performance and scalable solutions.
Take ownership of the complete Data Science and Machine Learning workflow: ideation, data processing (ETL), modeling, testing, deployment, monitoring and iteration.
Proactively suggest, research and prototype new ideas for data and ML solutions.


What We're Looking For 🔎


Bachelor or MsC degree in engineering, mathematics, statistics, physics, or another quantitative field.
Good understanding of ML concepts and techniques, and the whole ML development lifecycle.
Experience building complex data products and ML solutions to real-life problems in a production-oriented environment, identifying the right techniques to solve the problem at hand.
Strong coding skills (Python is a must, but other languages are also valued), capable of building robust data and ML software.
Experience with common libraries and frameworks such as Pandas, Numpy, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch.
Advanced in SQL, capable of getting the data required from the appropriate sources, and building and maintaining data pipelines if needed (experience in tools such as Airflow or DBT would be a plus).
Analytical and rigorous mindset, but also innovative and proactive, with autonomy and a team-player attitude.
Fluent communication skills in English (both written and spoken), capable of explaining complex concepts to peers and stakeholders.


What Would Be A Plus 🚀


Experience working within the Logistics, Trust & Safety or Customer Service domains.
Experience working within an eCommerce or Marketplace platform, or in a product-tech company.
Experience working within the AWS cloud (Redshift, S3, Lambda), and with cloud MLaaS solutions such as Amazon SageMaker (preferably), but also Google Vertex AI, Microsoft Azure ML, and other MLOps tools (MLFlow, Flyte, Feast, Kubeflow, etc).
Familiarity with MLOps philosophy.
Experience with GenAI tools (AWS Bedrock) and use cases (chatbot, RAG, etc).
Experience working with Big Data technologies (Spark)
Experience with data visualization tools (Looker, Amplitude, Tableau, or others)..


Do note that all our jobs are 📍 Barcelona based. We work in a mostly remote capacity offering great flexibility to our employees, but we believe in the power of getting together regularly in our office. As a first iteration, we expect a 4+ day/month office attendance for which the specifics are decided on a team level.

Wallapop is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees as we want Wallapop to be a place for everyone.

We sponsor visa processes for international candidates when applicable and provide legal & admin support along the process combined with a competitive relocation package.

Additionally to the opportunity to contribute to an agile product set up and work together towards achieving our meaningful mission, we offer the following 🍭 Perks & Benefits:


Competitive phantom shares package for all employees
Generous individual learning budget of 2k per year
Group and individual English & Spanish lessons as part of our working day
Private Health Insurance with Cigna
Flexible working hours + short Fridays
Flexible remuneration to deduct from gross salary (kindergarten/food/transport check)
Gym & Wellness plan, including physiotherapist in the office
Generous referral Program & Charity Donation
Bonus for weddings & newborns
Wallapop Renta (Tax income support)
Monthly plan for free shipping, bumps & home-pick-up on our services
Workiversary Gifts and Birthday Surprises
Contribution towards your WIFI in your monthly payroll
One-off payment based on compensation package to go towards setting up your home office
Relocation package (monetary support and legal advice) and visa sponsorship, if applicable
26 holidays per year
TOP hardware of your choice (latest Apple or Windows)


What does the hiring process for this position look like? 👀 **Please, note that all interviews take place remotely over hangouts.**

Intro Call - run by talent acquisition, focus on providing more information about the role and the company as well as going over your experience, motivation and expectations. This usually takes 45-60 minutes.

Task - you will be assigned a task to submit within 5 up to 7 days where you will be able to showcase your expertise and technical skills required for the role.

Expertise Interview - run by the hiring team, focus on the required core skills and the ability to deliver in a given context. This usually takes 60-90 minutes.

Stakeholder Interview - run by relevant stakeholders reflecting the reality of the context of the role, focus on the ability to collaborate & deliver in a cross-functional set-up. This usually takes 60 minutes.

Culture-Add Interview - run by culture interviewers, focus on adherence to Wallapop's purpose and business proposition. This usually takes 60 minutes.

Offer - should you be the right candidate, your offer will be discussed over a call with talent acquisition and will then be confirmed in writing.

Backed by top investors such as Accel, Insight Partners & Naver Corp we bring our total valuation to 690 million EUR and are embarking on our international journey with the aim to become the world's best unique goods trading platform.

The Challenge 🧩

The Wallapop platform generates tons of data and, with a mature data infrastructure already in place, the area of Data Science and Machine Learning is gaining momentum. The team is experiencing significant growth and, with many initiatives down the road, the opportunities are endless.

As a Data Scientist in the Wallapop Managed Marketplace Tribe, you will be working on the Data Science and Machine Learning initiatives aimed at improving the whole marketplace dynamics. This will include topics such as optimizing our Shipping and Logistics operations, fighting against fraud and contributing to the Trust & Safety of our platform, and improving the Customer Service user experience.

You will work closely with other Data Scientists, Product Managers, Engineers, UX Researchers, and Analysts to understand the product requirements and explore possible data and ML solutions. You will own the whole product lifecycle, from gathering the data needed to prototyping, building, evaluating, and iterating end-to-end solutions, all within Wallapop's Data and ML Platforms.

Additionally, you will have the opportunity to work on internal research projects, exploring new technologies and building PoCs that could ultimately become data products or insights, and be valuable for Wallapop.

You will be part of a growing Machine Learning team (7) within the Data & Analytics department (30+).

What You Will Do 👇

  • Take responsibility for the Data Science and ML initiatives within the Managed Marketplace Tribe
  • Work with multidisciplinary Product teams to identify opportunities and gather requirements (both in terms of product and tech).
  • Work with Data Scientists, ML Engineers and Software Engineers to explore and build the best performance and scalable solutions.
  • Take ownership of the complete Data Science and Machine Learning workflow: ideation, data processing (ETL), modeling, testing, deployment, monitoring and iteration.
  • Proactively suggest, research and prototype new ideas for data and ML solutions.

What We're Looking For 🔎

  • Bachelor or MsC degree in engineering, mathematics, statistics, physics, or another quantitative field.
  • Good understanding of ML concepts and techniques, and the whole ML development lifecycle.
  • Experience building complex data products and ML solutions to real-life problems in a production-oriented environment, identifying the right techniques to solve the problem at hand.
  • Strong coding skills (Python is a must, but other languages are also valued), capable of building robust data and ML software.
  • Experience with common libraries and frameworks such as Pandas, Numpy, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch.
  • Advanced in SQL, capable of getting the data required from the appropriate sources, and building and maintaining data pipelines if needed (experience in tools such as Airflow or DBT would be a plus).
  • Analytical and rigorous mindset, but also innovative and proactive, with autonomy and a team-player attitude.
  • Fluent communication skills in English (both written and spoken), capable of explaining complex concepts to peers and stakeholders.

What Would Be A Plus 🚀

  • Experience working within the Logistics, Trust & Safety or Customer Service domains.
  • Experience working within an eCommerce or Marketplace platform, or in a product-tech company.
  • Experience working within the AWS cloud (Redshift, S3, Lambda), and with cloud MLaaS solutions such as Amazon SageMaker (preferably), but also Google Vertex AI, Microsoft Azure ML, and other MLOps tools (MLFlow, Flyte, Feast, Kubeflow, etc).
  • Familiarity with MLOps philosophy.
  • Experience with GenAI tools (AWS Bedrock) and use cases (chatbot, RAG, etc).
  • Experience working with Big Data technologies (Spark)
  • Experience with data visualization tools (Looker, Amplitude, Tableau, or others)..

Do note that all our jobs are 📍 Barcelona based. We work in a mostly remote capacity offering great flexibility to our employees, but we believe in the power of getting together regularly in our office. As a first iteration, we expect a 4+ day/month office attendance for which the specifics are decided on a team level.

Wallapop is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees as we want Wallapop to be a place for everyone.

We sponsor visa processes for international candidates when applicable and provide legal & admin support along the process combined with a competitive relocation package.

Additionally to the opportunity to contribute to an agile product set up and work together towards achieving our meaningful mission, we offer the following 🍭 Perks & Benefits:

  • Competitive phantom shares package for all employees
  • Generous individual learning budget of 2k per year
  • Group and individual English & Spanish lessons as part of our working day
  • Private Health Insurance with Cigna
  • Flexible working hours + short Fridays
  • Flexible remuneration to deduct from gross salary (kindergarten/food/transport check)
  • Gym & Wellness plan, including physiotherapist in the office
  • Generous referral Program & Charity Donation
  • Bonus for weddings & newborns
  • Wallapop Renta (Tax income support)
  • Monthly plan for free shipping, bumps & home-pick-up on our services
  • Workiversary Gifts and Birthday Surprises
  • Contribution towards your WIFI in your monthly payroll
  • One-off payment based on compensation package to go towards setting up your home office
  • Relocation package (monetary support and legal advice) and visa sponsorship, if applicable
  • 26 holidays per year
  • TOP hardware of your choice (latest Apple or Windows)

What does the hiring process for this position look like? 👀 **Please, note that all interviews take place remotely over hangouts.**

Intro Call - run by talent acquisition, focus on providing more information about the role and the company as well as going over your experience, motivation and expectations. This usually takes 45-60 minutes.

Task - you will be assigned a task to submit within 5 up to 7 days where you will be able to showcase your expertise and technical skills required for the role.

Expertise Interview - run by the hiring team, focus on the required core skills and the ability to deliver in a given context. This usually takes 60-90 minutes.

Stakeholder Interview - run by relevant stakeholders reflecting the reality of the context of the role, focus on the ability to collaborate & deliver in a cross-functional set-up. This usually takes 60 minutes.

Culture-Add Interview - run by culture interviewers, focus on adherence to Wallapop's purpose and business proposition. This usually takes 60 minutes.

Offer - should you be the right candidate, your offer will be discussed over a call with talent acquisition and will then be confirmed in writing.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Do you want to drive the next urban revolution? At Cabify, that’s what we’re doing. We aim to make cities better places to live by improving mobility for the people living in them, connecting riders to drivers at the touch of a button. Maybe one day cities will be places where nobody needs a private car. But we’ve still got a long way to go… want to be part of this journey?




About the position:




You will join Cabify’s Data Science team, a group of highly motivated specialists with access to all data within the organization. The team is involved in all main areas of the company, including vehicle and route management, understanding user experience, pricing, fraud detection, and marketing optimization (see for yourself: exhibit A, exhibit B, exhibit C). You will work with state-of-the-art tools and infrastructure to help improve everyday operations in more than 40 cities worldwide. Cabify's Data Science team provides a unique opportunity to not only test and learn but also implement great ideas that will shape the future of our cities.




As a Data Scientist in our team, you will:




Develop high-impact data science projects, working closely with other data, engineering, product and business teams.
Participate in the results analysis of real-life experiments, following academy-standard scientific methods and procedures, to demonstrate the impact of the new product features we develop.
Develop new machine-learning models.
Help to convert the team’s technical knowledge into real and tangible business insights that bring value to the company.
Join product development conversations, discussing new features and bringing the data science perspective to everything we build.




What we’re looking for:




At least 3 years of professional experience working as a data scientist or equivalent research role.
Strong educational background, e.g Masters in Computer Science, Physics, Engineering, Mathematics, Economics, etc.
Solid foundations in Probability & Statistics.
Experience working with Python for data analysis and data visualization libraries.
Experience with data extraction and processing. Capable of writing complex SQL code.
Ability to work autonomously in an unstructured environment.




Bonus Points:




Experience bringing machine learning to production, with all its subtleties: deploying, training, testing, model degradation, model serving, etc.
Experience with state-of-the-art methods in topics like deep learning models, time series analysis, bayesian statistics, causal inference, etc.
Experience with geo data modeling, analysis and visualization.




What’s it like to work at Cabify?:




We’re a company full of happy, motivated people and we never want that to change. Here are some more reasons why it rocks to be part of our high-performance team:

Excellent Salary conditions: Individual Contributor L3 [38-53K€]
Hybrid Remote (Model). Our office is located in Madrid.
Flexible work environment & hours.
Regular team events.
Recharge Days (10 Free Fridays annually)
Cabify staff free rides.
Personal development programs based on our career paths.
Flexible compensation plan: Restaurant tickets, transport tickets, healthcare and childcare.
iFeel: Free access to the iFeel platform, so you can take care of your emotional well-being through therapy sessions.
Coursera: your own license in Coursera to take as many courses as you wish and continue developing your skills.
A pet room, so you don’t have to leave your furry friend at home.
And last but not least...free coffee and fruit!




Cabify is proud of being an equal opportunity workplace. We celebrate diversity and we are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees regardless of background, gender, religion, orientation, age or ability. Join us!

Title: DATA SCIENTIST AND MACHINE LEARNING ENGINEER - Energy and Food
Description:
Are you ready to embark on a challenging journey of discovering and applying novel Machine Learning and AI-driven solutions in trending topics including energy optimization in microgrids with renewable energies and electric vehicle, interoperable digital twins for advanced monitoring and management of assets or novel technologies to contribute to better practices in the agricultural sector?

The Applied Artificial Intelligence Unit of EURECAT is looking for a highly motivated Data Scientist and Machine Learning engineer to help us pave the way in digitalization and development of new technologies for creating a smarter and more sustainable future.

Responsabilities

As a valued member of our team, your role encompasses several critical dimensions:


Design and implement solutions based on mathematical algorithms and classical ML: supervised and unsupervised models, regression models, classification, clustering, dimensionality reduction, optimization, recommendation systems, time series, semi-supervised learning, etc.
Design and implement solutions based on Deep Learning techniques like Recurrent Neural Networks and Autoencoders.
Research innovative techniques and methods in the field of artificial intelligence to stay up-to-date with new trends.
Practical application and experimentation of state-of-the-art techniques in projects and challenges to be developed.
Global Impact: Collaborate on scientific publications, sharing your insights with the wider research community.
Tailored Growth: We recognize your unique strengths and interests. Your responsibilities will evolve accordingly, fostering personalized development within our team.
Project Leadership: As you grow and the projects unfold, your adept project management skills will steer us toward success.



WHAT EURECAT CAN OFFER YOU?

Our group is specialized in applied research and development on ML and AI solutions. The Applied Artificial Intelligence Unit of Eurecat develops innovative solutions (algorithms, methods, platforms) based on a combination of artificial intelligence and knowledge management technologies, especially for the industrial, energy and sustainability sectors. We have over 12 years of experience pushing the adoption of state-of-the-art AI and ML solutions for our private customers as well as for relevant European research projects! Check out our portfolio:

Applied Artificial Intelligence - Eurecat (applied-artificial-intelligence-eurecat.github.io)

Applied Artificial Intelligence Eurecat Technological Centre

And …


Permanent contract
Hybrid work (3 home office/2 work in the office)
Flexible Schedule
Shorter workday on Friday and Summer Schedule
Flexible remuneration package (health insurance, transport, lunch, studies - training and kindergarten)
Eurecat workers can join the Eurecat Academy courses
Eurecat workers can attend to our weekly thematic sessions to be aware of Eurecat areas of knowledge.
Language’s training (English, Catalan and Spanish)



Requirements:


Passion for DataScience and ML.
Basic studies: Physics, Math, Energy engineering, Agronomy, Forestry engineering.
Superior studies: MSc or equivalent in ML, AI, Computer Vision, or a related field.
Hands-on experience with Machine Learning, Deep Learning, with a track record of applying AI techniques.
Proficiency in Python and knowledge of basic libraries like Numpy, Pandas, Matplotlib, Scikit-Learn, SciPy.
Knowledge of mathematical optimization and its implementation in python with libraries like Pyomo or PuLP.
Valuable knowledge in some deep learning libraries like Keras, PyTorch and Tensorflow.
Open minded and multidisciplinary: Eager to learn new domains.
Dynamic communication skills, allowing you to effectively convey complex ideas and collaborate with colleagues from diverse backgrounds.
A readiness to travel when needed, embracing opportunities to connect with clients, partners, and collaborators worldwide.
Languages: English, Catalan, Spanish

Title: Junior AI Engineer
Description:
Ubicación:

Madrid, ES, 28046

Fecha: 16 jun. 2024

¿Eres únic@?

Entonces eres KPMG Originals. Un modo de entender la vida y tu profesión diferente desde donde marcar la diferencia. Un modo de crecer en un ambiente profesional que busca cambiar las cosas, transformar las empresas y la sociedad.

Ven, alcanza tus metas, supera tus límites en un ambiente profesional único y únete a una firma que es más que una firma de Servicios Profesionales. Sé KPMG Originals.

¿Qué podrás hacer?

Desde el equipo de LIGHTHOUSE, nuestra área de Data & Analytics, ayudamos a nuestros clientes a encontrar la eficiencia y el alto rendimiento en todas sus funciones TIC, tanto internas como externas hacia sus unidades de negocio y proveedores: buscando la máxima eficiencia en la operación de sus servicios y ajustando sus costes; así como incrementando su trascendencia en la cuenta de resultados y facilitando la innovación.

Actualmente, nos encontramos ampliando el equipo con un/a perfil Junior con experienica en proyectos de Inteligencia Artificial.

¿Qué necesitas saber?


Tener 1-2 años de experiencia laboral
Título universitario en Ciencias de la Computación, Ingeniería, Matemáticas u otro campo relacionado.
Experiencia en el desarrollo / configuración de modelos de IA generativa y/o LLM, deseable experiencia / certificación en servicios Azure OpenAI
Habilidad de programación en lenguajes como Python.
Experiencia en el manejo de grandes conjuntos de datos y en el procesamiento de datos para tareas de IA.
Capacidad de colaborar de manera efectiva en un entorno interdisciplinario.


¿Qué valor añadido te podemos aportar?


Un gran ambiente de trabajo, tanto dentro como fuera de la oficina
Oportunidades internacionales y red de contactos global
Formacióncontinuay plan de carrera a tu medida
Salario competitivo y plan de remuneración flexible
31 días laborables de vacaciones
La tarde de tu cumpleaños libre
Flexibilidad y posibilidad de teletrabajo
Acceso a Kteam, nuestra plataforma de bienestar, servicios, solidaridad y promociones
Los beneficios pueden variar para programas de becas y/o prácticas


Nuestro compromiso en KPMG es promover ambientes de trabajo en los que se trate con respeto y dignidad a las personas, garantizando la igualdad de oportunidades en su selección, formación y promoción ofreciendo un entorno de trabajo libre de cualquier discriminación por motivo de género, edad, discapacidad, orientación sexual, identidad o expresión de género, religión, etnia, estado civil o cualquier otra circunstancia personal o social. Y es que cada persona tiene un valor único y especial que aportar a la firma.

Nuestros valores marcan la diferencia. Marca la diferencia, impulsa tu talento.

Title: ML Engineer
Description:
We are offering an ML Engineer position, to build the global contextual advertising leader.




WHO WE ARE

Seedtag is the leading Contextual Advertising Platform. Our proprietary, machine learning-based technology provides a human-like understanding of the content on the web, the highest level of brand safety in the industry and unmatched cookieless targeting capabilities.

We engage with the market on both demand and supply sides to create, activate and launch high-quality advertising campaigns at scale. We are committed to creating a more beautiful, respectful and engaging way to do advertising.




KEY FIGURES

2014 · Founded by two ex-Googlers

2018 · 16M total turnover & Internationalization & Getting growth

2021 · Capital raise of 40M€ & +12 countries & +300 Seedtaggers

2022 · Funding round of 250M€ + expansion into the U.S. market + 400 Seedtaggers

2024 · Expansion into 18 countries + 600 Seedtaggers




YOUR CHALLENGE

The AdExchange is the space where supply opportunities (ad slots) are matched to advertising demand items (ads). Just like the former trading pits in the stock market, opportunities to sell and buy are constantly created and resolved.

To make the most of this flow of monetization opportunities, we develop, train and deploy different Machine Learning models. At our AdExhange, you will find a myriad of use cases, each requiring different mathematical and infrastructure solutions. Our approach is strongly product-oriented, with a firm mathematical basis and proficient software development practices.

You will work close to the production environment and hand-to-hand with the team’s Data Scientists, MLOps and Data engineers, getting immediate feedback on the response of your solution. From your head to the cluster, you will have a barrier-free highway and a proactive team around you to support your work and ideas.

This is a high-impact project that will shape the future of Seedtag
You will work on identifying, exploring, and making sense of data sources
You will partner closely with the Data component of our squad, to enhance the delivery of the intelligence into the AdExchange
You will develop machine learning solutions to solve business problems: anomaly detection, price optimization, etc.
You will develop and deploy production-oriented data software




YOU WILL SUCCEED IN THIS ROLE IF

You have 2-4 years of solid experience in data science and machine learning
You (preferentially) have a degree in computer science, engineering, statistics, mathematics, physics or another degree with a strong quantitative component.
You understand the theoretical functioning of the main algorithms in ML and you have experience applying these to real problems
You have ample experience with one or more of these machine learning tools: Scikit-learn, Tensorflow, PyTorch, etc.
You have a strong understanding of the technical and business requirements of the projects you work on, and you can think strategically to ensure that your work aligns with the goals of the company.
You are energized by tackling complex technical problems and figuring out creative solutions.
You are committed to staying up-to-date with the latest developments in back-end engineering and are always looking for ways to improve your skills and knowledge.
You are comfortable working collaboratively with others, and you are able to effectively communicate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
You are comfortable working in a dynamic, fast-paced environment, and you are able to adjust to changing priorities and requirements.




SEEDTAG PERKS

Key moment to join Seedtag in terms of growth and opportunities
High-performance tier salary bands excellent compensation
One Seedtag: Work for a month from any of our open offices with travel and stay paid if you’re a top performer (think of Brazil, Mexico...)
Real flexible schedule to balance work and personal life
A harassment-free, supportive and safe environment to ensure the healthiest and friendliest professional experience fostering diversity at all levels
Optional company-paid English, French and/or Spanish courses
Access to learning opportunities (learning & development budget) and Odilo online academy, where you can learn as much as you want
We love what we do, but we also love having fun. We have many team activities you can join and enjoy with your colleagues! A Yearly offsite with all the company, team offsites, and Holiday events…




BENEFITS OF WORKING AT SEEDTAG

Growth: International, highly demanding work environment in one of the fastest growing AdTech companies in Europe. We reject "that’s the way it’s always been done". In Seedtag you can find an energetic, fresh workplace, multicultural work environment where our members are from different countries in Europe, LATAM, the US and so many more!
Impact: The chance to have a direct impact, here you don't work for the sake of working, we all have an impact on Seedtag in our own way, rowing in the same direction
Diversity of methodology and people: Seedtag DNA is unique and highly appreciated by very different types of Seedtagers. We embrace diversity and encourage everyone to seek the best version of themselves and to show who they really are. With a totally flexible methodology
Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you, you can work from home, the beach or the office in our hybrid mode




Are you ready to join the Seedtag adventure? Then send us your CV!

Show more

2018 · 16M total turnover & Internationalization & Getting growth

2021 · Capital raise of 40M€ & +12 countries & +300 Seedtaggers

2022 · Funding round of 250M€ + expansion into the U.S. market + 400 Seedtaggers

2024 · Expansion into 18 countries + 600 Seedtaggers


YOUR CHALLENGE

The AdExchange is the space where supply opportunities (ad slots) are matched to advertising demand items (ads). Just like the former trading pits in the stock market, opportunities to sell and buy are constantly created and resolved.

To make the most of this flow of monetization opportunities, we develop, train and deploy different Machine Learning models. At our AdExhange, you will find a myriad of use cases, each requiring different mathematical and infrastructure solutions. Our approach is strongly product-oriented, with a firm mathematical basis and proficient software development practices.

You will work close to the production environment and hand-to-hand with the team’s Data Scientists, MLOps and Data engineers, getting immediate feedback on the response of your solution. From your head to the cluster, you will have a barrier-free highway and a proactive team around you to support your work and ideas.

  • This is a high-impact project that will shape the future of Seedtag
  • You will work on identifying, exploring, and making sense of data sources
  • You will partner closely with the Data component of our squad, to enhance the delivery of the intelligence into the AdExchange
  • You will develop machine learning solutions to solve business problems: anomaly detection, price optimization, etc.
  • You will develop and deploy production-oriented data software


YOU WILL SUCCEED IN THIS ROLE IF

  • You have 2-4 years of solid experience in data science and machine learning
  • You (preferentially) have a degree in computer science, engineering, statistics, mathematics, physics or another degree with a strong quantitative component.
  • You understand the theoretical functioning of the main algorithms in ML and you have experience applying these to real problems
  • You have ample experience with one or more of these machine learning tools: Scikit-learn, Tensorflow, PyTorch, etc.
  • You have a strong understanding of the technical and business requirements of the projects you work on, and you can think strategically to ensure that your work aligns with the goals of the company.
  • You are energized by tackling complex technical problems and figuring out creative solutions.
  • You are committed to staying up-to-date with the latest developments in back-end engineering and are always looking for ways to improve your skills and knowledge.
  • You are comfortable working collaboratively with others, and you are able to effectively communicate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • You are comfortable working in a dynamic, fast-paced environment, and you are able to adjust to changing priorities and requirements.


SEEDTAG PERKS

  • Key moment to join Seedtag in terms of growth and opportunities
  • High-performance tier salary bands excellent compensation
  • One Seedtag: Work for a month from any of our open offices with travel and stay paid if you’re a top performer (think of Brazil, Mexico...)
  • Real flexible schedule to balance work and personal life
  • A harassment-free, supportive and safe environment to ensure the healthiest and friendliest professional experience fostering diversity at all levels
  • Optional company-paid English, French and/or Spanish courses
  • Access to learning opportunities (learning & development budget) and Odilo online academy, where you can learn as much as you want
  • We love what we do, but we also love having fun. We have many team activities you can join and enjoy with your colleagues! A Yearly offsite with all the company, team offsites, and Holiday events…


BENEFITS OF WORKING AT SEEDTAG

  • Growth: International, highly demanding work environment in one of the fastest growing AdTech companies in Europe. We reject "that’s the way it’s always been done". In Seedtag you can find an energetic, fresh workplace, multicultural work environment where our members are from different countries in Europe, LATAM, the US and so many more!
  • Impact: The chance to have a direct impact, here you don't work for the sake of working, we all have an impact on Seedtag in our own way, rowing in the same direction
  • Diversity of methodology and people: Seedtag DNA is unique and highly appreciated by very different types of Seedtagers. We embrace diversity and encourage everyone to seek the best version of themselves and to show who they really are. With a totally flexible methodology
  • Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you, you can work from home, the beach or the office in our hybrid mode


Are you ready to join the Seedtag adventure? Then send us your CV!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Sobre la Empresa:

Factorenergia es una empresa consolidada en el sector de la electricidad, el gas y las energías renovables con más de 250.000 clientes en España. Actualmente estamos buscando un Científico de Datos con experiencia en la herramienta LLM y conocimientos de Git para nuestras oficinas en Barcelona (Av. Diagonal 575 - Edificio CC L'ILLA DIAGONAL).




Responsabilidades:




Planificar y ejecutar varios proyectos de ciencia de datos según la demanda.
Desarrollar algoritmos utilizando y optimizando LLM (como ChatGPT).
Análisis de datos: procesos de transformación, segmentación y análisis de datos.
Identificar información valiosa a través de la gestión efectiva de los datos.




Requisitos:




Buscamos candidatos/as con título universitario en Ciencia de Datos u otras áreas relacionadas y amplia experiencia en aprendizaje automático. El candidato ideal debería tener excelentes habilidades analíticas, conocimientos de bases de datos SQL, habilidades interpersonales y conocimientos de Git.




Habilidades técnicas:




Aprendizaje automático
Herramientas LLM como ChatGPT
SQL Server
Git
Experiencia de desarrollo con Python




Ofrecemos:




Salario competitivo basado en habilidades y experiencia.
Proyecto estable con oportunidades de crecimiento.
Equipo de trabajo multidisciplinario y excelente ambiente laboral.
Viernes intensivos todo el año hasta las 15 hs.
Posibilidad de realizar modalidad de trabajo híbrido (casa-oficina); Superado el período de evaluación.
Descuento especial en la Luz & Gas para trabajadores de Factorenergia.

Show more

Title: Científico/a de datos
Place: Las Palmas de Gran Canaria, Canary Islands, Spain
Description:
¿Quieres un desafío profesional en una consultora IT de primer nivel? ¡Esta es tu oportunidad! En Intelequia, nos encontramos en búsqueda de talento innovador y apasionado por las tecnologías de vanguardia para unirse a nuestro equipo.




Con más de 15 años de experiencia en el sector y reconocidos como una de las mejores empresas de tecnología para trabajar en España, según Great Place To Work, estamos especializados en realizar servicios TIC en la nube operando a nivel nacional e internacional, abarcando áreas como Infraestructura, Ciberseguridad, Inteligencia Artificial y Desarrollos en .NET y Low Code.




Nuestra misión es acompañar a nuestros clientes en cada etapa de sus proyectos de IT, liderando sus iniciativas y ofreciendo soluciones punteras que impulsen su crecimiento y eficiencia en un entorno tecnológico cada vez más competitivo.




Si estás dispuesto a asumir nuevos retos y formar parte de un equipo comprometido con la excelencia, ¡queremos conocerte!




¿QUÉ BUSCAMOS?

Un/a Data Scientist, con al menos 2 años de experiencia en el sector.




FUNCIONES

Realizar análisis exploratorios de datos para comprender los patrones y tendencias de los datos.
Construir y entrenar modelos de machine learning para resolver problemas de negocio y predecir resultados.
Implementar modelos de machine learning en sistemas de producción.
Interpretar y comunicar los resultados del análisis de datos a stakeholders técnicos y no técnicos.
Mantenerse actualizado sobre las últimas técnicas y herramientas de ciencia de datos.




REQUISITOS MÍNIMOS

Formación en Ingeniería Técnica/Informática o similares.
Valorable estar en posición de master
Conocimientos en Python o R.
Conocimientos sólidos en estadística y técnicas de machine learning.
Experiencia con bibliotecas de machine learning populares (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-Learn).
Habilidades de visualización de datos para comunicar resultados de forma clara y efectiva (Matplotlib, Seaborn, Plotly).
Excelentes habilidades de comunicación y colaboración.
Capacidad para trabajar de forma independiente y como parte de un equipo.
Orientación a los detalles y capacidad para resolver problemas.




En Intelequia creemos firmemente que la felicidad de nuestro equipo influye directamente en el trabajo realizado, para ello TE OFRECEMOS:




Incorporación inmediata a un PROYECTO ILUSIONANTE Y MOTIVADOR.
Formación continua para desarrollo profesional: idiomas, certificaciones, competencias profesionales, etc.
Trabajo en modelo híbrido donde puedes trabajar 3 días a la semana en casa.
Buen clima laboral, formando parte de un equipo de grandes profesionales donde poder crecer y aportar
Trabajar en una empresa Great Place to Work

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
This position is for an international team, so please attach your resume in English.

We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Software Engineer to join our growing team. The ideal candidate will have a passion for solving complex problems, writing clean and efficient code, and working on a cloud-based application.




Your responsibilities:




Design, develop, and maintain software applications using Python
Work with Docker to containerize applications and manage their deployment
Design, develop, and maintain applications using Kafka or Pulsar




Your profile:




Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or a related field. We would also consider candidates with other technical titles (FP)
Senior software development experience: java, C++, Python.
1+ year of experience in software development using Python.
Experience with SQL and database design.
Knowledge of Cloud technologies (e.g. Azure).
Proficient in Git and experience with CI/CD pipelines.
Experience with Docker and container orchestration (e.g. Kubernetes).
Strong experience with either Kafka or Pulsar (plus).
Ability to work independently as well as in a team environment
Experience with connected vehicles is a plus.




Our offer:




You you will be part of an exciting endeavor in an international company with European roots.
A hands-on onboarding with an experienced team to get familiar with the business and domain-related processes.
Space for creating innovative solutions and ideas within a professional team practicing Agile methodologies.




We have a unique corporate culture, driven by family tradition since 1892. We strive to create a work environment conducive to personal growth, satisfaction and achievement. Kapsch is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We attach great importance to a balance in the diversity of our employees. Therefore we welcome all applications without regard to gender, age, religious beliefs/ideology, sexual orientation, ethnicity or national origin.




This position is for an international team, so please attach your resume in English.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer

Customer Facing

Remote, Europe




Join a team where your work with AI makes a real difference. Be part of a supportive culture that values collaboration and impactful work.




Role Overview: As a Machine Learning Engineer, you'll work closely with the commercial team to provide technical expertise and tailor solutions to meet customer needs. You'll participate in conferences, gather customer feedback, and ensure technical wins.




We'd love to hear from you if you have the following skills:

Strong technical background in ML, deep learning workflows, and Python.
Experience with cloud technologies, particularly AWS.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and travel occasionally.
Cloud/ML and experience with enterprise-level customers.




Company Culture and Benefits:

Remote-first company with occasional in-person gatherings.
Stipend for a co-working space.
Equity-based compensation.




Interview Process:

CV Screening.
Technical Deep Dive.
Collaboration and Team Fit Interviews.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We are looking for a talented Data scientist to join and change the world of advertising together, as we are developing the most sophisticated and intelligent AdExchange for our brands and publishers. Are you the one?




Who are we?




We are a scale-up in a 📈 hyper-growth phase so we need to ensure that our product can scale up, and we need your 🧠 brain for this!




On the contextual side, by combining Natural Language Processing and Computer Vision, our proprietary Machine Learning-based technology provides a human-like understanding of the content of the web. We find the best context for each ad, while providing unparalleled risk-mitigation capabilities that protect advertisers from showing their ads on pages that could be damaging to their brand. All of this, without relying on cookies or any other tracking mechanisms.




On the AdExchange side, we are creating the most efficient exchange in the market by combining Optimization, Unsupervised, and Reinforcement Learning techniques. We put together the most valuable sources of demand and supply. From our Floor Strategy on the channel side to our Header Bidding solution at the preBid connector, the AdExchange becomes smarter every day.

We want you to 💡 innovate and we have plenty of space for you to develop professionally!




As leaders of ⚙️ Contextual Advertising Technologies; at Seedtag, our goal is to promote a better advertising industry where effective advertising respects users' privacy and experience.




Key Figures




2014 · Founded

2018 · 16M€ total turnover getting growth and going international

2021 · Raised 40M€ , 230 Seedtaggers in 10 countries

2022 · Raised 250M€ , expanding into the U.S market

👉 2024 · Where will you bring us? 😎




What are our challenges?

…in numbers 🤯:

We handle more than 180 billion of events per day
We process on average 600,000 web pages per hour
Our CDN serves 1.5 petabytes every month to 200 million devices worldwide

So... it’s all about 🏎️ speed and infrastructure reliance.

Your 😎 mission (if you accept it) is to make our platform more intelligent.




Your Challenge: build the intelligence of our AdExchange

The AdExchange is the space where supply opportunities (ad slots) are matched to advertising demand items (ads). Just like the former trading pits in the stock market, opportunities to sell and buy are constantly created and resolved.




To make the most of this flow of monetization opportunities, we develop, train and deploy different Machine Learning models. At our AdExhange, you will find a myriad of use cases, each requiring different mathematical and infrastructure solutions. Our approach is strongly product-oriented, with a firm mathematical basis and proficient software development practices.




You will work close to the production environment and hand-to-hand with the team’s Data Scientists, MLOps and Data engineers, getting immediate feedback on the response of your solution. From your head to the cluster, you will have a barrier-free highway and a proactive team around you to support your work and ideas.




🚀 This is a high-impact project that will shape the future of Seedtag.
🕵🏻 You will work identifying, exploring, and making sense of data sources.
🧑‍💼 You will partner closely with the Data component of our squad, to enhance the delivery of the intelligence into the AdExchange.
⚙️ You will develop machine learning solutions to solve business problems: anomaly detection, price optimization, etc.
💻 You will develop and deploy production-oriented data software.




If you are up to the challenge and want to be a part of a talented and passionate team, we encourage you to apply for this position.




Our core values




🎯 Outcome over output

Our core tech values reflect our commitment to delivering exceptional results, fostering a culture of continuous learning, and always putting the customer's needs first. We believe that success comes from focusing on the outcomes rather than just the output. Our tech team aims to solve problems that make a meaningful difference, and we measure our success by the impact we have on the customer.




💡Failure is allowed, learning is a must

We also recognize that failure is an inevitable part of the innovation process. Our team understands that setbacks are opportunities to learn and grow. We believe in testing early and often, and we continuously iterate and improve until we arrive at the best solution.




👨‍👩‍👧‍👦 We are all scouts

Another core value we hold is that we are all scouts. We believe in leaving things better than we found them. This means we take ownership of our work and strive to improve the systems and processes we touch. We encourage our team members to be proactive in identifying areas for improvement, and we value those who take the initiative to implement positive changes. Our goal is to leave a lasting, positive impact on our projects and our team.




📊 We are data-driven

Lastly, our team is data-driven. We believe that making informed decisions based on data is crucial to our success. Our engineering team uses data to guide our decision-making process and to identify opportunities for improvement. We are committed to using data to continuously monitor and optimize our systems and processes to ensure that we are delivering the best possible outcome for our customers.




How do we work?

Our modelling stack consists of a series of well-stablished Python frameworks such as Scikit Learn/Spacy/Torch/Tensorflow, but we embrace the adoption of new cool tools.

Our backend consists of a series of containerized (Docker) microservices built in Python, and deployed in a Kubernetes cluster.




Our MLOps infrastructure is built upon MLFlow and DVC to track, trace and register the models, the metrics, and the data. We love automatizing things, and our deployments are triggered via Jenkins for the code, and MLFlow for the models. Every service API we build is self-managed, so that you can fine-tune every detail of the serving process.




Our cloud infrastructure runs on Google Cloud. We store data in Redis, MongoDB, ElasticSearch, GCS, and other storage systems. We love kafka, event-based and data-streaming architecture models.




You Will Succeed If:

🚀 You have 4-5 years of solid experience in data science and machine learning.
🧐 You (preferentially) have a degree in computer science, engineering, statistics, mathematics, physics or another degree with a strong quantitative component.
📐You understand the theoretical functioning of the main algorithms in ML and you have experience applying these to real problems.
⚙️ You care about producing maintainable code over time using good programming practices. you have experience in testing and with CI/CD tools.
🌟 Nice to have: you have experience deploying models into production with docker and kubernetes. You are familiar with the MLOps universe.
🛠️ You have ample experience with one or more of these machine learning tools: Scikit-learn, Tensorflow, PyTorch, etc.
🤔 You are a big-picture thinker who can see the forest and the trees. You have a strong understanding of the technical and business requirements of the projects you work on, and you can think strategically to ensure that your work aligns with the goals of the company.
💡 You are a problem solver who loves a good challenge. You are energized by tackling complex technical problems and figuring out creative solutions.
📚 You are a continuous learner who is passionate about your craft. You are committed to staying up-to-date with the latest developments in back-end engineering and are always looking for ways to improve your skills and knowledge.
🤝 You are a strong communicator who can work effectively in a team. You are comfortable working collaboratively with others, and you are able to effectively communicate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
🏎️ You are adaptable and flexible. You are comfortable working in a dynamic, fast-paced environment, and you are able to adjust to changing priorities and requirements.

If you possess these qualities and are excited about the opportunity to work on challenging, high-impact projects with a talented and passionate team, we encourage you to apply for this position.




What else is cool at Seedtag ?

🌏 Unlimited work from home
⌛ Excellent work/life balance
🏳️‍🌈 Harassment-free, supportive and safe environment to ensure the healthiest and friendliest professional experience fostering diversity at all level
💻 Latest Macbook Pro + 🏠 1,000€ for your home setup
💼 Mentoring and Career development with learning budget
🍽️🚘👶 Restaurant, transports and kindergarten tickets
🏥 Medical insurance discounts

… but there is more !

Free 🇬🇧 English / 🇪🇸 Spanish / 🇫🇷 French lessons
🏉 Paid travel to our HQ in Madrid to gather with your teams
🥳 Paid offsite meetup with your team, yearly company gathering,🎄Christmas events…
💯 "One Seedtag": a special award which allows you to work for a month from any of our open offices with paid travel and accommodation (think of Brazil, Mexico..., 🏖)




It's really a 🚀 key moment to jump in the bandwagon with us and join the Seedtag 🥾 adventure! If you are interested in joining one of the fastest growing 📈 startups in Europe and work on massive scalability challenges, this is the place for you.

Show more

At our AdExhange, you will find a myriad of use cases, each requiring different mathematical and infrastructure solutions. Our approach is strongly product-oriented, with a firm mathematical basis and proficient software development practices.


You will work close to the production environment and hand-to-hand with the team’s Data Scientists, MLOps and Data engineers, getting immediate feedback on the response of your solution. From your head to the cluster, you will have a barrier-free highway and a proactive team around you to support your work and ideas.


  • 🚀 This is a high-impact project that will shape the future of Seedtag.
  • 🕵🏻 You will work identifying, exploring, and making sense of data sources.
  • 🧑‍💼 You will partner closely with the Data component of our squad, to enhance the delivery of the intelligence into the AdExchange.
  • ⚙️ You will develop machine learning solutions to solve business problems: anomaly detection, price optimization, etc.
  • 💻 You will develop and deploy production-oriented data software.


If you are up to the challenge and want to be a part of a talented and passionate team, we encourage you to apply for this position.


Our core values


🎯 Outcome over output

Our core tech values reflect our commitment to delivering exceptional results, fostering a culture of continuous learning, and always putting the customer's needs first. We believe that success comes from focusing on the outcomes rather than just the output. Our tech team aims to solve problems that make a meaningful difference, and we measure our success by the impact we have on the customer.


💡Failure is allowed, learning is a must

We also recognize that failure is an inevitable part of the innovation process. Our team understands that setbacks are opportunities to learn and grow. We believe in testing early and often, and we continuously iterate and improve until we arrive at the best solution.


👨‍👩‍👧‍👦 We are all scouts

Another core value we hold is that we are all scouts. We believe in leaving things better than we found them. This means we take ownership of our work and strive to improve the systems and processes we touch. We encourage our team members to be proactive in identifying areas for improvement, and we value those who take the initiative to implement positive changes. Our goal is to leave a lasting, positive impact on our projects and our team.


📊 We are data-driven

Lastly, our team is data-driven. We believe that making informed decisions based on data is crucial to our success. Our engineering team uses data to guide our decision-making process and to identify opportunities for improvement. We are committed to using data to continuously monitor and optimize our systems and processes to ensure that we are delivering the best possible outcome for our customers.


How do we work?

Our modelling stack consists of a series of well-stablished Python frameworks such as Scikit Learn/Spacy/Torch/Tensorflow, but we embrace the adoption of new cool tools.

Our backend consists of a series of containerized (Docker) microservices built in Python, and deployed in a Kubernetes cluster.


Our MLOps infrastructure is built upon MLFlow and DVC to track, trace and register the models, the metrics, and the data. We love automatizing things, and our deployments are triggered via Jenkins for the code, and MLFlow for the models. Every service API we build is self-managed, so that you can fine-tune every detail of the serving process.


Our cloud infrastructure runs on Google Cloud. We store data in Redis, MongoDB, ElasticSearch, GCS, and other storage systems. We love kafka, event-based and data-streaming architecture models.


You Will Succeed If:

  • 🚀 You have 4-5 years of solid experience in data science and machine learning.
  • 🧐 You (preferentially) have a degree in computer science, engineering, statistics, mathematics, physics or another degree with a strong quantitative component.
  • 📐You understand the theoretical functioning of the main algorithms in ML and you have experience applying these to real problems.
  • ⚙️ You care about producing maintainable code over time using good programming practices. you have experience in testing and with CI/CD tools.
  • 🌟 Nice to have: you have experience deploying models into production with docker and kubernetes. You are familiar with the MLOps universe.
  • 🛠️ You have ample experience with one or more of these machine learning tools: Scikit-learn, Tensorflow, PyTorch, etc.
  • 🤔 You are a big-picture thinker who can see the forest and the trees. You have a strong understanding of the technical and business requirements of the projects you work on, and you can think strategically to ensure that your work aligns with the goals of the company.
  • 💡 You are a problem solver who loves a good challenge. You are energized by tackling complex technical problems and figuring out creative solutions.
  • 📚 You are a continuous learner who is passionate about your craft. You are committed to staying up-to-date with the latest developments in back-end engineering and are always looking for ways to improve your skills and knowledge.
  • 🤝 You are a strong communicator who can work effectively in a team. You are comfortable working collaboratively with others, and you are able to effectively communicate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • 🏎️ You are adaptable and flexible. You are comfortable working in a dynamic, fast-paced environment, and you are able to adjust to changing priorities and requirements.

If you possess these qualities and are excited about the opportunity to work on challenging, high-impact projects with a talented and passionate team, we encourage you to apply for this position.


What else is cool at Seedtag ?

  • 🌏 Unlimited work from home
  • ⌛ Excellent work/life balance
  • 🏳️‍🌈 Harassment-free, supportive and safe environment to ensure the healthiest and friendliest professional experience fostering diversity at all level
  • 💻 Latest Macbook Pro + 🏠 1,000€ for your home setup
  • 💼 Mentoring and Career development with learning budget
  • 🍽️🚘👶 Restaurant, transports and kindergarten tickets
  • 🏥 Medical insurance discounts

… but there is more !

  • Free 🇬🇧 English / 🇪🇸 Spanish / 🇫🇷 French lessons
  • 🏉 Paid travel to our HQ in Madrid to gather with your teams
  • 🥳 Paid offsite meetup with your team, yearly company gathering,🎄Christmas events…
  • 💯 "One Seedtag": a special award which allows you to work for a month from any of our open offices with paid travel and accommodation (think of Brazil, Mexico..., 🏖)


It's really a 🚀 key moment to jump in the bandwagon with us and join the Seedtag 🥾 adventure! If you are interested in joining one of the fastest growing 📈 startups in Europe and work on massive scalability challenges, this is the place for you.

Title: Data Scientist: Fraud Detection
Description:
Únete como Data Scientist: Fraud Detection a una compañía de elevada reputación en el sector del comercio omnicanal, donde tu principal función será desarrollar e implementar herramientas para detección de fraudes internos, contribuyendo a la mejora del funcionamiento de la empresa.

¿Cuáles serán tus principales funciones?:

Desarrollar e implementar herramienta para la detección de fraudes internos.
Monitorizar parte de la actividad para establecer alertas de posibles fraudes e incumplimientos.
Detectar incidencias en el sistema interno para prevenirlas.
Ayudar en las investigaciones internas de los Responsables de Control Interno a través del dato.
Desarrollar los proyectos del área de IA y robótica.
Parametrizar y gestionar la herramienta de autocontrol del grupo, automatizándola para ganar productividad en las tiendas.
Participar de manera activa en proyectos transversales.

¿Qué necesitamos de ti?

Formación académica en informática, matemática, ingeniería o relacionada.
Mínimo 3 años de experiencia en implementación de nuevas herramientas el área de Análisis de Datos, Auditorías o afines.
Conocimientos avanzados de Excel, técnicas analíticas y herramientas de visualización de datos.
Manejo del idioma inglés (B2).
Interés por la detección de fraudes.
Productividad, autonomia y organización.

Por ultimo, pero no menos importante, ofrecemos:

Ambiente laboral dinámico y colaborativo con oportunidades de desarrollo profesional.
Contrato indefinido con remuneración competitiva acorde a la experiencia y responsabilidades.
Horario de trabajo flexible para promover el equilibrio entre vida laboral y personal.
Formación continua y acceso a recursos de aprendizaje.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Remerge helps leading mobile app marketers increase revenue and retention by activating, re-engaging and retaining high-value users through programmatic in-app ads. Founded in 2014, Remerge has established itself as a leading app retargeting player globally, with offices spanning Berlin, New York, Singapore, Seoul and Tokyo. Our international team of experts has contributed to the growth of hundreds of apps across all major verticals, including gaming, on-demand delivery, e-commerce, and finance.

Job mission

We are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to join our team and work on real time bidding systems which make over a billion bids a day. Your team's mission is to model user behaviour, value of the bid, price of the bid and eventually the attribution. Our goal is to automate the advertising strategy, to reach the targets for our clients as a enterprise solution.

About The Team

Our team consists of Machine Learning and Data Science experts from diverse backgrounds and are looking for an additional member for our team with experience in mixed data predictive modelling. In our day-to-day we collaborate with development as well as business teams to build a good bidding system. Joining this team you can expect colleagues that are curious about new models, analytical techniques, different architectures and more, and appreciate spending time together sparring on these ideas.

Job responsibilities


Develop and deploy complex machine learning models in Python and Tensorflow.
Ability to plan and manage different stages of model development (research, development, metrics, real world experiments, deployment)
Be the person of contact for business teams in a region, on client issue and provide solutions / explanations on system behaviour
Be the second line of contact on the models, during on-call alerts.


Job requirements


2-3 years experience working in programatic advertising (DSP, SSP, Ad exchange). Work in retargeting campaigns is a plus.
A good foundation in mathematics of neural networks, loss functions, metrics to analyse performance.
Familiar with Machine learning infrastructure , building models for continuous deployment .
Expertise in building multi modal machine learning models is a plus.
Expertise in dealing with mixed data, models on large data (> 1B records), embedding layers.
Good software engineering skills.
Good communication skills, explaining model behaviour to business teams.


Our promise


Unlimited vacation days - for real. We give you the freedom to figure out the most productive work-life balance for you
Mentorship program for technical and non-technical skills
A truly modern place to work: work from home, from our brand new office in Berlin - your work environment is yours to design. We also offer flexibility in remote work.
Generous remuneration package including virtual shares, a dedicated education budget
End of the year bonus determined by company performance
Travel to our offices around the globe for a short term assignment for up to a month every two years
Comfortable work setup - laptop, phone, screen(s), standing desk etc.
Support for your setup while working from home
Wellness benefits such as sports memberships, Nilo Health subscription and internet reimbursements
Company events including breakfast twice a week, team lunches, birthday and milestone celebrations, quarterly team events and company-wide parties & trips


Remerge is an Equal Opportunity Employer: all qualified applicants are considered for positions regardless of race, ethnic origin, gender, age, religion or belief, marital status, gender identification, sexual orientation, veteran status or disability. We're looking forward to your application!

Description:
¡Ampliamos nuestro equipo de Data & AI!. Seleccionamos consultor/a con experiencia como Data Scientist para incorporarse de manera estable a nuestros equipos de Madrid.

¿Qué ofrecemos?


Estupendo ambiente laboral, las personas que componen nuestros equipos lo hacen posible
Teletrabajo y horario flexible.
Formación a medida y posibilidad de participar en gremios y grupos transversales de difusión de conocimientos de todo tipo.
Plan de carrera personalizado, para que alcances las metas que te propongas.
Estabilidad laboral.
Beneficios sociales con nuestra plataforma de retribución flexible y diversas iniciativas de salud y bienestar con nuestro programa VASS Care.

Al menos tres años de experiencia en desarrollo de proyectos como científico de datos con Python.

Experiencia en el desarrollo y entrenamiento de modelos

Experiencia en proyectos RAG con librerías LLM

Skills: Python, ML, DL, Langchain, Huggingface

Title: Data Scientist/ Sr Data Scientist
Description:
En Repsol apostamos por las personas, por eso el equipo humano que formamos reúne a profesionales con una amplia variedad de trayectorias, habilidades y culturas. La combinación de tal riqueza de talentos y recursos permite crear equipos diversos, comprometidos y dinámicos que trabajan para hacer realidad los objetivos de la compañía y nos impulsan hacia el éxito.

Al mismo tiempo, promovemos espacios de trabajo inclusivos que contribuyan a que las personas pueden desarrollar todo su potencial profesional, fomentando el trabajo en equipo y la colaboración entre las distintas áreas de Repsol.

Por ello, estamos comprometidos con la igualdad de oportunidades, la diversidad y la inclusión, desarrollando procesos de selección accesibles, basados en capacidades y libres de cualquier forma de discriminación.

Repsol en su ambicioso plan de Transformación Digital, quiere incorporar un Data Scientist para su Data & Analytics HUB. Rol profesional o profesional Sr.

  

Responsabilidades


Trabaje con las partes interesadas de toda la organización para identificar oportunidades para aprovechar los datos de la empresa para impulsar soluciones empresariales.
Extraiga y analice datos de las bases de datos de la empresa para impulsar la optimización y mejora del desarrollo de productos, técnicas de marketing y estrategias comerciales.
Evaluar la eficacia y precisión de las nuevas fuentes de datos y técnicas de recopilación de datos.
Desarrollar modelos de datos y algoritmos personalizados para aplicar a conjuntos de datos.
Utilice el modelado predictivo para aumentar y optimizar las experiencias de los clientes, la generación de ingresos, la orientación de anuncios y otros resultados comerciales.
Desarrollar el marco de pruebas A / B de la empresa y la calidad del modelo de prueba.
Coordine con diferentes equipos funcionales para implementar modelos y monitorear resultados.
Desarrollar procesos y herramientas para monitorear y analizar el rendimiento del modelo y la precisión de los datos



Requisitos


Experiencia en el uso de lenguajes informáticos estadísticos (R, Python, SLQ, etc.) para manipular datos y extraer información de grandes conjuntos de datos.
Conocimiento de una variedad de técnicas de aprendizaje automático (agrupamiento, aprendizaje de árbol de decisión, redes neuronales artificiales, etc.) y sus ventajas / inconvenientes en el mundo real.
Conocimiento de técnicas y conceptos estadísticos avanzados (regresión, propiedades de distribuciones, pruebas estadísticas y uso adecuado, etc.) y experiencia con aplicaciones.
Excelentes habilidades de comunicación escrita y verbal para coordinar entre equipos.
Un impulso para aprender y dominar nuevas tecnologías y técnicas.
Estamos buscando a alguien con 5-7 años de experiencia, tiene una maestría o doctorado en estadística, matemáticas, informática u otro campo cuantitativo, y está familiarizado con los siguientes softwares / herramientas:
Conocimiento y experiencia en técnicas estadísticas y de minería de datos: GLM/Regresión, Random Forest, Boosting, Trees, minería de textos, análisis de redes sociales, etc.
Experiencia consultando bases de datos y utilizando herramientas informáticas estadísticas: SQL, SAS, R, Python, Tensor Flow, etc.
Experiencia en la creación y uso de algoritmos y estadísticas avanzadas de aprendizaje automático: regresión, simulación, análisis de escenarios, modelado, clustering, árboles de decisión, redes neuronales, etc.
Experiencia con herramientas de datos/computación distribuidas: Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Gurobi, MySQL, etc.
Experiencia visualizando / presentando datos para las partes interesadas usando: Periscope, Business Objects, D3, ggplot, etc.



¿Qué ofrecemos?


Competitivo paquete salarial
Propuesta de retribución flexible (seguro de salud, plan de pensiones, ticket restaurant, etc.)
Medidas de conciliación y bienestar:
Horario flexible y posibilidad de teletrabajo
Jornada intensiva todos los viernes y verano
Magníficas instalaciones con cafeterías, banco, servicio médico, gimnasio, servicio de fisioterapia y nutrición y banco de tiempo
Servicios asistenciales al empleado y a su entorno.



Facilitar metodologías, herramientas y recursos especializados en materia de Big Data, Análisis Avanzados y Gestión de Datos. Gestionando y

  • Competitivo paquete salarial
  • Propuesta de retribución flexible (seguro de salud, plan de pensiones, ticket restaurant, etc.)
  • Medidas de conciliación y bienestar:
  • Horario flexible y posibilidad de teletrabajo
  • Jornada intensiva todos los viernes y verano

Title: Data Scientist MLOps Python/Pyspark
Description:
Cognodata, empresa líder en el sector Customer Science, Customer Experience y Advanced Analytics, requiere un Data Scientist senior, con al menos 5 años de experiencia en MLOps y programación Python/Pyspark




Responsabilidades:

Participar en el desarrollo y la implementación de la infraestructura y las herramientas de MLOps para modelos de aprendizaje automático
Identificación y resolución de problemas empresariales mediante técnicas de aprendizaje automático.
Proactividad, capacidad para trabajar con poca supervisión de acuerdo con los requerimientos establecidos.
Automatización de procesos en Python
Tratamiento de datos con PySpark.
Análisis y presentación de los resultados
Participación directa o indirectamente en las reuniones con el cliente en todo lo relacionado con el entorno del proyecto.







Conocimientos:

Programación avanzada en Python y PySpark (se realizarán pruebas)
Experiencia con tecnologías de bases de datos y consultas SQL.
Conocimiento teórico y práctico en técnicas estadísticas y de Machine Learning.
Experiencia mínima de 5 años en puestos similares.

Show more

Cognodata, empresa líder en el sector Customer Science, Customer Experience y Advanced Analytics, requiere un Data Scientist senior, con al menos 5 años de experiencia en MLOps y programación Python/Pyspark


Responsabilidades:

  • Participar en el desarrollo y la implementación de la infraestructura y las herramientas de MLOps para modelos de aprendizaje automático
  • Identificación y resolución de problemas empresariales mediante técnicas de aprendizaje automático.
  • Proactividad, capacidad para trabajar con poca supervisión de acuerdo con los requerimientos establecidos.
  • Automatización de procesos en Python
  • Tratamiento de datos con PySpark.
  • Análisis y presentación de los resultados
  • Participación directa o indirectamente en las reuniones con el cliente en todo lo relacionado con el entorno del proyecto.



Conocimientos:

  • Programación avanzada en Python y PySpark (se realizarán pruebas)
  • Experiencia con tecnologías de bases de datos y consultas SQL.
  • Conocimiento teórico y práctico en técnicas estadísticas y de Machine Learning.
  • Experiencia mínima de 5 años en puestos similares.

Title: Data Science Graduate - Starts in September
Description:
Job description: The Opportunity

 

We are looking for a Data Forecaster to join our Advanced Analytics HUB.

 

As a Junior Data Analyst focusing on demand forecasting, you will play a key role in analyzing data to predict future product demand and optimize inventory management. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to gather and interpret data, develop forecasting models, and provide actionable insights to enhance decision-making processes.

This position is ideal for a highly analytical individual with a passion for data and a results-oriented mindset. We are looking for someone who embodies our values, is not afraid to challenge, innovate, experiment, and move at a fast pace.

This Graduate position will have a duration of 1 year, with the possibility of joining the company as an employee at the end of the program!

What you'll get to do

 

Key Responsibilities:

Collect, clean, and analyze large datasets to support demand forecasting activities
Develop, implement, and maintain demand forecasting models using Python
Interpret data trends and patterns to provide actionable insights for the planning team
Collaborate with various departments, including IT, pricing, marketing, and supply chain, to understand forecasting needs and improve accuracy
Prepare and present detailed reports and visualizations to communicate findings to stakeholders
Continuously monitor and improve forecasting models to ensure their accuracy and reliability
Stay updated with industry trends and best practices in data analysis and demand forecasting
We'd love to meet you if you have

 

Required Knowledge:

Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field
Proficiency in Python for data analysis and model development
Experience with common Python libraries and frameworks such as Pandas, Numpy, and Scikit-learn
Proficiency in Excel 

Required Skills:

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with keen attention to detail
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to convey complex data insights in an understandable manner
Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously

 

Valuable Skills and Experience:

Familiarity with additional Python libraries and frameworks such as TensorFlow, Keras, and PyTorch
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, SAC, Power BI)
Experience with data querying languages (SQL)
Familiarity with SAP or other ERP systems
Knowledge of cloud computing platforms (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud, Azure)

Languages:

Spanish and English: Fluent level is a must; French will be valued

A few things you'll love about us
An entrepreneurial, creative and welcoming work culture
A range of learning and development opportunities
An international company with plenty of opportunities to grow
Company events and well-being initiatives
Hybrid work policy
On onsite gym and restaurant
Flexible work arrangements

Title: Python Developer
Description:
The Junior Python Developer, Pharmacovigilance (PV) Solutions will be responsible for day-to-day python development and oversight of TransPerfect’s proprietary tools, updating and maintaining code, and may be in daily and regular contact with internal clients including project managers and pharmacovigilance specialists who utilize the tools on a daily basis.




Job description:

Write code to build web crawlers for our clients’ selected local literature websites
Write code to help maintain web crawler and other applications, address bugs, and work on new features
Perform regular maintenance on crawlers to ensure optimal performance on all crawlers
Maintain excellent records via Request Tracker, in line with Good Pharmacovigilance Practices (GVP) best practices, with a strong focus on Good Documentation Practice
Assist Project Managers with all technical aspects of their day to day workflows, learn and become an expert-level user of all TPT technologies utilized for the local literature monitoring service including but not limited to:

o TPT crawler

o TLS Express

o Digital Reef

o Relativity

o Trial Interactive

Grow existing client relationships through service and technology-led development
Complete all other tasks that are deemed appropriate for this role and assigned by the manager/supervisor




Required skills:

Superior written and spoken communication skills in English
Proficiency writing code in Python
Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook)
Aptitude to learn and excel in various technology mediums
Exceptional problem-solving and critical thinking skills
Excellent attention to detail to ensure high-quality deliverables to client




Required experience and qualifications:

Minimum Bachelor’s degree
Minimum 1-2 years of python experience or within the tech industry




Desired skills and experience:

Able to multitask in a fast-paced environment
Experience with web crawling/web scraping a/o browser automation methods and technologies (specifically Selenium and Requests)
Proficiency with Git for version control




By applying, I confirm I have read and accept TransPerfect's Privacy Policy: https://www.transperfect.com/about/data-privacy-recruiting
